Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About Us
Founded in 1999 and listed on NASDAQ in 2003 and HKEX in 2021, Trip.com Group is a leading global travel service provider comprising of Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar.

Across its platforms, Trip.com Group integrates travel resources from industry partners and helps travellers worldwide pursue the perfect trip with exceptional travel products and services.

We have four Customer Service Centres for Trip.com established in Japan, Korea, the UK, and the Philippines, providing 24/7 customer service in 19 different languages.

We have more than 30,000 employees scattered across 30 countries in Asia, Europe, the Americas, and Oceania, striving to expand our global markets and aiming to be the world’s leading and most trusted family of online travel brands that aspire to deliver the perfect trip at the best price for every traveller.

The Role:
As a Junior Data Analyst on our Partnerships and Affiliate Marketing team, you will play a critical role in supporting the success of our affiliate programs and partnerships. We are looking for someone who takes initiative, actively seeks out opportunities for improvement, and is eager to contribute to our team’s success.

In this Role, your responsibilities will include:

* Monitor and Analyze Performance: Track key performance indicators (KPIs) across various channels, identifying trends, and communicating to the team any anomalies, and opportunities for optimization.
* Generate Insights for Campaign Optimization: Assist in analyzing data to provide insights that help improve campaign performance, ROI, and overall marketing effectiveness.
* Develop and Maintain Dashboards: Contribute to the creation and maintenance of dashboards that provide real-time insights into program performance, making it easy for stakeholders to understand key metrics and trends.
* Support Partnership Strategies: Work with business developers and learn about the effectiveness of different partnerships, contributing data-driven recommendations for future collaborations.
* Take Initiative in Problem-Solving: Proactively identify issues or opportunities for optimization and develop strategies that improve overall performance.
* Collaborate Internationally: Work alongside marketing teams based in Shanghai and other global locations, ensuring that efforts align with broader marketing strategies and global business goals.
* Assist in Conducting Experiments: Support the design and analysis of experiments to test new strategies, creatives, or partnership models, contributing to data-driven decisions.

What you'll Need to Succeed:

* Strong Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret data, identify trends, and provide actionable insights.
* Communication Skills: Ability to translate data findings into clear, actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Basic SQL Knowledge: Familiarity with SQL for querying and managing datasets is preferred, with a willingness to develop these skills further.
* Experience with Data Analysis Tools: Strong skills in Excel or Google Sheets, including functions, data manipulation, and pivot tables. Experience with tools like Python, R, or BigQuery is a plus, offering opportunities to engage in more complex data analysis and automation.
* Basic Data Visualization Experience: Familiarity with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar for creating dashboards and visual reports, with opportunities to develop proficiency.
* Interest in Partnerships and Affiliates: A strong curiosity and willingness to learn about affiliate marketing and partnership strategies, and how different factors affect our KPIs.
* Proactive, Collaborative, and Solution-Oriented: A self-starter who takes initiative in identifying opportunities for improvement and optimization. You enjoy developing solutions and contributing to projects, while also working collaboratively with cross-functional teams across different regions to achieve shared goals.

Why Trip.com Group
We offer a stage to unleash your full potential and drive global impact. As an international team, we embrace an open and inclusive culture that supports and respect team members in and out of the workplace. Everyone is on a trip, whether it's a career trip or a life trip. At Trip.com Group, you can define your own trip by setting a goal and celebrate your success by recognizing the progress you have made.
What’s more?

* Our rapid business growth in global offers abundant career opportunities at various levels and in multiple functions

* Internal transfer is encouraged, and global job rotation program enable you to pursue a global career path and make global impact

* We provide learning opportunities to further your career in areas of leadership capability, soft skill and professional expertise.

* We encourage flexible work arrangement

* Have fun with company-sponsored greetings and activities at holidays, birthdays, and colorful team events.

Find out more job opportunities at https://careers.trip.com

Have a good trip, and see you soon!

Title: Data Analyst (Freelance)
Description:
About the role:

As a Data Analyst, you will have the exciting opportunity to collaborate closely with our dynamic teams and working on multiple tasks. You will play an important role in creating engaging and insightful data visualizations using Tableau, using advanced data analysis and modelling techniques to find valuable trends and patterns within our datasets. Your involvement in developing and maintaining data models, reports, and workflows will be crucial to our success. Furthermore, you will actively engage with various business units, gaining a deep understanding of their unique needs and creating customized dashboards and solutions to meet and exceed their expectations.




About the project:

Duration: 2-3 months

The project contains 2 parts of development:

The backend (data warehouse ) using the in-house data centre to develop a solution from data collocation to structured database (in storge ) ,
The frontend (visualisation ) : using the structured database in storge with the Tableau we cerate advance models flows in addition to build the dashboard visualizations.




What are the expectations/requirements?

You are already based in the Netherlands

Re-creation of existing dashboard and visualizations from PowerBI to tableau.

Creating data models from database using tableau Prep for visualizations

Creating new deep dives upon request

Interacting with multiple stakeholders to understand their requirements and implementing them in their dashboards

Gaid and support the stakeholders to understand and unlock the potential dashboard

Creating appealing dashboards and visualization, knowledge of UXUI would be nice




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the data solutions team to design, develop, and implement data-driven solutions
Create interactive and insightful data visualizations using Tableau
Perform complex data analysis and modelling to uncover trends, patterns, and insights using Tableau prep and SQL.
Assist in the development and maintenance of data pipelines and workflows
Discuss with business units (clients) to understand their needs and create dashboards tailored to their expectations
Contribute to the documentation of processes, methodologies, and best practices
Participate in team meetings, brainstorming sessions, and project planning activities




Want to know more about us?

We are serving the Swiss market as Switzerland’s leading IT & Telecom company. Thus, we are actively driving digitalization and networking, and tapping new paths for our customers and our employees. We do not know what the future is going to look like, but we definitely have the opportunity to shape it. To do so we are and act trustworthy, committed and curious.

Since 2019, we have been building up the coolest DevOps Center with a wonderful office at the World Trade Center in the heart of Rotterdam. We are currently recruiting IT passionate professionals who are keen on developing high-quality software, have an agile mindset and appreciate collaboration with motivated colleagues from all over the world.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you ready to jump on board with Latitude’s exciting journey and change the way people think and act using data? Do you love solving problems by mixing analytical insights with creativity? Are you entrepreneurial, eager to learn, and able to think strategically? If so, come join us as a Data Analyst and make a difference through innovation and data.




👁️‍🗨️ About the role:




We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join the Data and Analytics team of one of our clients in Amsterdam. This critical role will focus on the Property Management & ESG value stream of the Company, working closely together with the Domain Owner to build relevant data products that directly impact the Company’s reporting and operational processes. The Data Analyst will have full vertical responsibility for the data, from conceptualization to deployment, ensuring the integrity and accessibility of Property & ESG data across the organization.




This role is supported by the Data Platform Team, which is responsible for the technical platform that the data products are developed on.




💬 Key Responsibilities:




Design, develop, and maintain data products and solutions that support Property Management & ESG reporting operations.
Collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to identify data needs and translate business requirements into technical specifications.
Take full ownership of data products, overseeing the entire lifecycle from inception through to deployment and ongoing support.
Work closely with the data platform team to leverage platform services, ensuring robust, scalable, and efficient data solutions.
Ensure data quality and integrity, implementing best practices for data management and governance.
Stay abreast of industry trends and developments in data technology, applying insights to enhance data products and drive innovation within the company.




✔️ Ideal candidate capabilities:




A minimum of 3 years of experience in data product development.
Strong proficiency in data modelling, SQL and PowerBI.
Experience with Microsoft technology stack, Azure cloud data platform and understanding of data integration and ETL processes.
Familiarity with Data Mesh principles and data product thinking is an advantage.
We value strong problem-solving skills, with a creative approach to tackling complex challenges.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, capable of working effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree, preferably with a quantitive and scientific background




🧭 Personal growth path:




We are considered experts in what we do and continuous learning is an important value to us. That’s why we find it important that you have a curious mindset and never want to stop learning. That also means that you will have the opportunity to continuously develop your technical and business skills, and we will facilitate you in whatever path you choose. Whether you want to excel in a (lead) technical role or want to combine or move to a more strategic or product-oriented role, we will support you along the way.




⛷️ Here’s some of the other things you will do at Latitude:




Collaborate with your clients to discover the true business problem they are facing.
Work together with Latitude’s data strategists to develop data strategies and execute them.
Design and implement data products which extracts insights and identifies opportunities from large and complex data sets.
Develop and present compelling business cases to clients, articulating the value of data strategies and products.
Work with clients to develop data-driven KPIs and metrics to measure business performance and ROI.
Develop and maintain strong client relationships, providing strategic guidance and support for our clients.




🌐 About Latitude:




We are a fast-growing data consulting start-up looking for talented people to help us develop innovative solutions for our clients. Our mission is to create simple and elegant solutions through data and AI that maximize the societal impact of people.




For many organizations, the use of data and AI remains uncharted territory. At Latitude, we believe that this world is often needlessly complex. We honor simplicity and purity, which is why we work with a clear end-user focus to ensure that our solutions create value for our clients. This means that we don’t focus on a specific tool for a problem, but instead surgically define the problem before determining if we need to implement a data strategy, BI solution, machine learning model, or perhaps transform the client’s data architecture.

Title: Commercial Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

This is B&S

B&S exists to make premium consumer goods available to everyone, anywhere. We believe that getting access to consumer products that bring joy and comfort into everyday lives, should be easy around the globe.

We are proud to see B&S featured in the latest edition of the #MT500 by MT/Sprout, which lists the 500 most reputable companies in the Netherlands. We rank #9 most attractive employer and #6 most sustainable company.

Are you curious about who we are as an employer and our thoughts on diversity and inclusion?Click here to find more information!

Job Description

Are you ready to give your career a flying start? As a Data Analyst, you’re not afraid to take the lead, you quickly master systems, and you have a keen eye for detail. This is your chance to develop and challenge yourself while playing a crucial role in the development of our procurement applications. Together, as a team, we continuously improve and streamline our processes. Are you ready to take the initiative?

Reach your full potential as a Data Analyst

The first year is all about learning and growing. You will get to know our company, our suppliers, and our processes by working with the support team. This will give you a good understanding of how we handle our orders and how purchase orders are created. In addition, you will join all developments related to our procurement application.

Our current application is used extensively by our buyers, but we see room for improvement. This is where you come in:


With support from the manager and your new colleagues, you will bring new and existing projects to fruition
Besides this, you implement them with current users, and become a key-user for the procurement application.
In addition, you collect and interpret information from these purchasing applications, such as quotes, supplier performance and other internal or external sources. In this role, you take charge of your own procurement and move within set frameworks, giving you the space to make decisions independently.


You measure your success by controlling the daily procurement processes, ensuring both quality and quantity. Based on existing deadlines and objectives for the projects, you try to complete them on time or inform the stakeholders of any delays.

Qualifications

This Is You

You have a sharp analytical mind and are incredibly quick at processing and analysing commercial data. Additionally, you are a pro at deciphering and automating complex systems and processes. With your keen eye, no detail escapes you. You take the lead in projects with great enthusiasm and ensure smooth coordination with all involved.

You


Have a bachelor's degree in a data-related field
Have affinity for data visualization
Are proficientin using data analysis tools and software


Additional Information

We offer you


A maximum salary ofup to €2800,- in line with your experience, plus a yearly fixed Christmas gratuityand a performance dependent bonus
Initially, a one-year contract with the prospect of permanent employment
25 vacation days, with the possibility to purchase additional days
A travel allowance of up to 75 km on single trip travel when working at the office, or an allowance if you’re working remotely (from home)
The flexibility to work 1 day a week from home
A pension scheme where 2/3rd of the pension costs are paid by us
The possibility to take courses related to your growth ambitions and function
A coaching program focused on your mental health (non-binding)
Participation in group insurance such as disability insurance and survivor’s insurance
Free use of our company gym and possibility to purchase fresh meals at our company restaurant

  • The possibility to take courses related to your growth ambitions and function
  • A coaching program focused on your mental health (non-binding)

Title: Data-analist
HTML:
Heb jij een passie voor data en wil je die inzetten om bedrijfsprocessen te optimaliseren? Wil jij in een rol stappen waar jouw analyses direct bijdragen aan het succes van onze organisatie? Bij Cameranu zoeken we jou om ons te helpen om op basis van data de juiste beslissingen te nemen!


De functie

Als BI Specialist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen, opschonen, analyseren, visualiseren en rapporteren van de informatiestromen binnen Cameranu. Je zorgt ervoor dat de data accuraat is en dat de inzichten worden afgestemd op de strategische en operationele behoeften van de organisatie.


Je werkt nauw samen met de Finance- en Business Controller, de CFO en je rapporteert direct aan onze Managing Director. Van A tot Z ben je verantwoordelijk voor alle aspecten van Business Intelligence binnen de organisatie. De data uit diverse bronnen vertaal je naar bruikbare inzichten en door middel van dashboards, rapportages en analyses lever jij strategische input die essentieel is voor het behalen van onze bedrijfsdoelstellingen.


Ter ondersteuning van de verschillende afdelingen waaronder marketing, inkoop en finance, analyseer je de data en breng je op basis van jouw inzichten strategische adviezen uit. Hiermee kunnen zij data-ondersteunde beslissingen maken zoals het definiëren van doelgroepen voor campagnes, en het inzichtelijk maken van marktaandelen en verschuivingen. Maar ook maak je eenmalige analyses over uiteenlopende onderwerpen zoals Black Friday, het openen van nieuwe winkels, of het verhogen van verzendkosten. Om de voortgang van de organisatie op een gestandaardiseerde en overzichtelijke manier inzichtelijk te maken ondersteun je bij wekelijkse, maandelijkse en jaarlijkse rapportages. Kortom; de samenwerking met jou is voor de afdelingen erg belangrijk om data effectief te integreren, strategische beslissingen te nemen en de interne processen te optimaliseren.


Dit breng je mee

  • Een afgeronde hbo-opleiding in de richting van Bedrijfskunde, ICT of Finance;
  • Affiniteit met retail of webshops en het verbeteren van processen met behulp van data;
  • Ervaring met Power BI, SQL, Excel en het bouwen van dashboards;
  • Programmeertalen zoals Python en R, en visualisatietools zoals Tableau en Zoho zijn een pré;
  • Een scherp analytisch vermogen en kunt complexe data vertalen naar heldere, bruikbare inzichten die het verschil maken.

  • Dit bieden wij

    • Een ambitieuze en dynamische organisatie waaraan je kunt bijdragen en je talenten kan inzetten;
    • Salaris tussen de €3.400,00 en €4.600,00 euro bruto per maand (op basis van een fulltime dienstverband) afhankelijk van je kennisniveau en ervaring;
    • Een jaarcontract dat wij daarna graag omzetten in een vast dienstverband;
    • Doorgroei- en ontwikkelmogelijkheden;
    • Goede pensioenregeling;
    • De mogelijkheid om je kennis te verdiepen en verbreden door het volgen van cursussen of opleidingen;
    • 25 vakantiedagen bij een fulltime dienstverband;
    • Korting op een collectieve zorgverzekering;
    • Aandacht voor jou als persoon door maandelijkse mogelijkheid voor een stoelmassage, vers fruit, en toegang tot een E-learning platform om jezelf te ontwikkelen;
    • Personeelskorting tot €500,00 per jaar op ons ruime assortiment;
    • Deelnemen aan een fietslease-regeling.


    Over Cameranu

    Cameranu is dé plek waar foto- en videografieliefhebbers elkaar ontmoeten, sparren, deskundig advies inwinnen of geven. Wij zijn dé ontmoetingsplek voor fotografen en filmmakers. Onze ambitie? De nummer 1 community van Nederland worden.


    Cameranu heeft 7 winkels in Nederland en België en een uitmuntende webshop. Met een omzet van bijna 100 miljoen zijn wij een Top50 e-commerce speler. Wij zijn een van de grootste Elektronica retailers van Nederland. Het hoofdkantoor zit op Urk, maar tegenwoordig hebben we ook een kantoor in Zwolle en werkplekken in onze winkels in Amsterdam en Rotterdam. Samen met onze winkels leveren bijna 200 collega’s vanuit passie voor hun vak dagelijks het beste aan de klant.


    Vanuit die passie en onze kennis van fotografie vinden wij uitmuntende service en snelle dienstverlening erg belangrijk. Per dag brengen 25.000 klanten een (online) bezoek aan ons. In een snel veranderende wereld is het onze ambitie om onszelf iedere dag een beetje beter te maken. Hiervoor bieden wij onze collega’s de ruimte om te groeien en met ideeën te komen. Bij nieuwe talenten zoeken wij iemand die met ons wil groeien en de ontwikkeling van ons bedrijf wil helpen vormgeven. Wij handelen dagelijks vanuit onze kernwaarden: vertrouwen, beleving, veiligheid en samen werken.


    Enthousiast geworden, solliciteer direct!

    Zin om deel uit te maken van ons team en samen te bouwen aan de toekomst van Cameranu? Stuur ons je cv en korte motivatie via de sollicitatiebutton! Ben je wel enthousiast, maar voldoe je nog niet aan alle vereisten? We moedigen je aan om toch te solliciteren; bij Cameranu kijken we verder dan het cv.

    Heb je nog vragen? Neem dan contact op met Richard Veurink (Interim Corporate Recruiter) via 06 476 871 66.


    Wat mag je verwachten na je sollicitatie

    1. Wij willen je graag beter leren kennen en nodigen je daarom uit voor een kennismaking bij ons op locatie Urk.
    2. Mooi, er is een wederzijdse klik! We doen je een passend voorstel.
    3. We tekenen de arbeidsovereenkomst en kijken ernaar uit om er samen een succes van te maken!

Title: Senior Data Analyst - GTM (Remote Europe)
Description:
n8n is a low-code platform for workflow automation and AI app integration, designed for technical users. It simplifies connecting to any app or API and enables the incorporation of AI into business processes. n8n is Source Code Available and has a passionate and engaged community of builders!

We were founded end of 2019 and currently:

🧑‍🤝‍🧑 We're a diverse team of 60 talented people

🚀 Our annual recurring revenue is growing 5x year-over-year

⭐️ With +44k GitHub stars, we are in the top 0.0001% most popular projects on Github

🌱 We now count a total of $20m in funding: we were Sequoia's first seed investment in Germany, and most recently secured a Series A extension (February 2024)

MISSIONS

🎯 Your main goal will be to unlock insights that drive revenue growth and optimize sales & marketing efficiency at n8n.

To achieve this, you will:

1- Empower Marketing with actionable data insights

🔍 Transform complex marketing data into accessible insights by optimizing our BigQuery setup and integrating with tools like Metabase

📊 Analyze campaign performance, demographic trends, and product telemetry to help the marketing team focus on high-impact areas

🔗 Centralize and link additional data sources such as HockeyStack, Reo.dev, and Scarf to deepen our understanding of user behavior

2- Support RevOps and Sales with strategic analytics

📈 Build and maintain dashboards that provide real-time visibility into sales performance and marketing ROI

🛠️ Run ad-hoc analyses to support sales strategies and inform RevOps decision-making

🧩 Develop attribution models to map out customer journeys and identify key conversion points

3- Optimize SEO and content strategies with data science

🔗 Leverage data science techniques to analyze node usage, SEO performance, and keyword strategies for maximum impact

🧠 Provide actionable recommendations to enhance our online presence and content marketing efforts

🚀 Explore new avenues for personalizing SEO strategies based on user interaction data

4- Proactively identify opportunities for growth

🌱 Continuously explore new data sources and methodologies to unlock further growth opportunities

🧩 Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure data-driven decision-making across the organization

💡 Be a proactive voice at the table, driving conversations on how data can further our ambitious goals

5- Drive data-driven decision making across GTM

🎯 Lead efforts to ensure data-driven decision-making becomes a core part of our GTM culture, empowering team members with the insights they need.

📚 Maintain and expand our GTM data documentation, ensuring consistency and accessibility for current and future team members.

🛠️ Set up and manage the necessary tools, systems, and processes that streamline data access and analysis for GTM teams.

Requirements

Must-have

🛠️ 5+ years of relevant experience: You have a proven track record in data analytics, data science, or business intelligence, particularly in a marketing context.

💻 Advanced SQL proficiency: You are skilled in complex queries, including aggregations, joins, and filters, and can make data accessible to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

🌐 Expertise with Google Analytics, Tag Manager, and BigQuery: You can handle data sources, manage transformations, and deliver actionable insights from complex datasets.

📊 Experience with revenue/sales CRM systems (especially Salesforce): You understand how to integrate CRM data with marketing analytics to drive sales and revenue growth.

🎯 Focus on business impact: You have a strong ability to translate data into strategic recommendations that directly contribute to revenue growth and operational efficiency.

⚙️ Pragmatic problem-solving skills: You are known for your bias for action and your ability to tackle complex challenges with practical solutions.

🔍 Proactive and curious mindset: You continuously seek out opportunities for analysis, always asking 'why' to uncover deeper insights.

📈 Experience in early-stage data teams: You've successfully set up tools, systems, and processes in a fast-paced, growing environment.

Nice-to-have

🔗 SEO and content marketing experience: You've worked with SEO datasets/tools and have a solid understanding of how to integrate these insights into broader marketing strategies.

📊 Data science/BI experience: You bring additional expertise in data science methodologies or business intelligence platforms, enhancing your ability to deliver sophisticated analyses.

n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country, you need to have existing right to work.


Our company language is English


You care about diversity and inclusion? We do too! Check out our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives at n8n.*

Benefits

💸 Competitive compensation

💪 Ownership: Our core value is to "empower others", and we give you a slice of n8n in the form of equity.

🏖️ Work/life balance: We work hard, but make sure everyone can properly recharge their batteries with 30 days holiday, plus public holidays wherever you are.

📈 Career growth: We are looking to hire 'rising stars', who can grow with the company into more senior roles. We give you €1k a year to spend on courses, books, events and coaching, to support you in developing your career.

🤩 A passionate team: We love our product, and we have regular office hackathons to see who can build the coolest thing with it!

🌏 Remote-first: Our team works remote from anywhere within Europe but we have regular off-sites to help build team bonds and alignment.

🙏 Transparency: We all know what everyone's working on, how's the company doing — the whole shebang.

🤝 Giving back: We're big fans of open source, and you'll get $100 per month to support projects you care about.

😍 Ambitious but kind culture where people love to work - our eNPS for 2023 is 100!

Disclaimer: If you see the same job posting in different locations, it's because we're hiring remotely and are pushing it to several locations! We're currently only making one RevOps hire. Please do not apply twice for the same position.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Chooose builds software to enable the lower carbon fuel value chains in hard-to-abate sectors.




Companies like Alaska Airlines, Air Canada, Delta Airlines, and Flexport use the Chooose platform to build, operate and scale their SAF programs, and to advance voluntary and compliance carbon initiatives.




With offices in Oslo and Miami, and remote employees across the US and Europe, we are a mission-oriented team that is scaling our business and climate impact in tandem. The company has raised $50M from leading venture capital and strategic investors.




The Data team is responsible for transforming and maintaining quality of external and system data, external facing analytical visualizations and providing insights and business intelligence to internal teams at CHOOOSE. This role will focus primarily on Business intelligence with the goal to empower our internal teams to perform better and the build of external facing visualizations.




What you'll do

Collaborate with internal stakeholders to streamline data-driven performance management.
Enabling self-serve metrics and empowering internal teams such as Account Management, Finance, Implementation, Product and Carbon Operations to leverage data to answer their questions.
Collaborate with the Product team to incorporate external facing visualizations into the CHOOOSE platform.




What you'll bring to the table

An understanding of querying languages (KQL and SQL)
An understanding of key data manipulation concepts
2-5 years of experience using data visualization tools and performing analysis in tools such as Google Suite and Microsoft Office
Ability to answer questions and problem-solve through data manipulation and visualizations deriving value for our internal organization
Solution-oriented mindset, leveraging data to problem solve
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple stakeholders




The interview process

The interview process will include a series of interviews with CHOOOSE Data team members and internal stakeholders. There will be a case study exercise that will be presented to the CHOOOSE Data team.




Pay, perks, & more

We offer a competitive salary, the option to participate in our employee equity program, flexible work hours, and access to 'Spaces' coworking space. Come join a fun and supportive team dedicated to advancing climate solutions and tackling significant challenges.




We value diversity and believe forming teams in which everyone can be their authentic self is key to our success. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds and different industries to apply.

Compensation will be based on experience and skill, commensurate with market rates, and will include both salary and equity in CHOOOSE.




CHOOOSE is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, religion (creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status. We are committed to providing an inclusive and welcoming environment to our employees and welcome input from candidates and employees on how we can enhance our inclusiveness.




Prerequisite for Employment: CHOOOSE may request to conduct background checks on prospective applicants to verify the information provided in the CV, transcripts, and other documentation. This background check may be carried out by our partner and will not be conducted without the applicant's prior consent. Prospective applicants will receive more information about this.

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Word jij onze nieuwe enthousiaste BI-engineer/consultant voor Zig | Insights?




Voor het onboarden en begeleiden van nieuwe klanten op ons BI-platform Zig | Insights zijn wij op zoek naar een enthousiaste BI-engineer/consultant.

Geloof jij net als wij dat de impact van data op organisaties steeds belangrijker wordt voor het vaststellen én behalen van doelstellingen en het maken van strategische keuzes? Wil jij met data een verschil maken, onder andere voor de maatschappelijke doelstellingen van onze klanten en hun klanten? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!




Wat ga je doen

Jij speelt een belangrijke rol in het aansluiten van nieuwe klanten op ons BI-platform en het vertalen van hun wensen naar bestaande standaarden of refinements voor nieuwe standaarden. Samen met je collega’s en de klanten blijf je nieuwe informatieproducten ontwikkelen, zoals KPI’s en visualisaties in Fabric/PowerBI. Met het team (22 collega’s) optimaliseer je continu het platform met innovaties en nieuwe functionaliteiten.




Als BI-engineer/consultant ben je dagelijks bezig om samen met de klant het maximale uit de samenwerking en het BI-platform te halen. Een aantal taken en verantwoordelijkheden die bij jouw rol horen zijn:




Het onboarden van nieuwe klanten op het Zig | Insights platform.
Het begeleiden van het projectteam bij de klant in het begrijpen en integreren van definities/indicatoren vanuit de informatieproducten in de organisatieprocessen.
Het begeleiden van de dagstart- en dageinde-sessies met de klant en het beheer van de backlog; samen met de projectleider de voortgang bewaken.
Analyseren en implementeren van oplossingen om klanten te helpen bij het analyseren en rapporteren van hun data, met als doel inzicht te verkrijgen in de bedrijfsprocessen en betere datagedreven strategische beslissingen te nemen.
Analyseren en uitwerken van de informatiebehoefte van klanten op een duidelijke en gestructureerde manier, en deze behoeften vertalen naar gedetailleerde specificaties om oplossingen te ontwikkelen die aansluiten bij de behoeften van de klanten.
Het ontzorgen van de klant in het proces van data ontsluiting, data preparatie en het bouwen aan integrale informatievoorziening.
Fungeren als interne specialist op het gebied van business intelligence, waarbij je voortdurend de nieuwste ontwikkelingen en trends binnen dit vakgebied volgt om je deskundigheid te maximaliseren.




Dit ben jij

Jij vindt het leuk om in een team te werken dat een sterke visie heeft om de vastgoedsector via data te professionaliseren. Je hebt een passie voor data en wilt deze graag delen met klanten. Je wilt hen helpen om meer datagedreven te werken en te groeien naar een datagedreven organisatie. Jij kunt de vertaalslag maken van klantvragen naar te ontwikkelen indicatoren en dashboards.




Als BI-engineer/consultant beschik je over de volgende kennis en ervaring:

HBO- of WO-werk- en denkniveau (bij voorkeur in de richting bedrijfskunde, informatica, data science of toegepaste wiskunde)
Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring in de richting van Business Intelligence en/of data analytics
Ervaring met data-visualisatie-tooling (bijvoorbeeld Power BI)
Sterke analytische en communicatieve vaardigheden
Vloeiend in Nederlands, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk




Een dikke pré is als je een achtergrond of kennis hebt in finance en/of goed bent in het overzien van processen.




Wat is Zig | Insights?

Zig Insights is hét innovatieve BI-platform voor de vastgoedsector. We begeleiden organisaties bij het verwerken van data tot waardevolle informatie, op een eenduidige en gestructureerde manier, waarbij we de standaarden van de sector gebruiken. Het BI-team van Zig helpt klanten met de stappen die nodig zijn om een datagedreven cultuur te creëren.




Onze dataspecialisten hebben de drive en ambitie om zichzelf steeds opnieuw uit te vinden en werken continu aan het verbeteren en optimaliseren van producten en diensten. Samen maken we mooie dingen. De collega’s binnen het team zijn een beetje eigenwijs, hebben humor, maar houden altijd de focus op het resultaat van de klant.




Wie zijn wij?

Wij zijn Zig. We ontwikkelen software voor de vastgoedbranche (woningcorporaties, studentenhuisvesters en commercieel vastgoed) en doen dit met veel plezier.




Wij helpen organisaties om dichter bij hun klanten te komen met slimme processen, innovatieve technologieën en data. Onze digitale oplossingen zorgen ervoor dat de focus op de klant zichtbaar en voelbaar is in het complete proces: van een woning zoeken en vinden tot aan bewonen en verhuizen. Wij maken wonen makkelijker.




Dit doen wij al meer dan 14 jaar met een enthousiast team van ruim 300 specialisten die werken in Huizen, Veenendaal en hybride. Meer dan 160 vastgoedorganisaties en 1,6 miljoen mensen maken gebruik van onze software.




Dit krijg je ervoor terug




Wij bespreken graag jouw salariswens tijdens onze eerste kennismaking. Het salaris ligt tussen de € 4500 en € 5500 op basis van een 40-urige werkweek, afhankelijk van jouw kennis en ervaring.
Ruimte om mee te denken over de doorontwikkeling van onze producten en jouw kennis te delen;
Ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen via de Zig Academy;
Werken bij een 'Great place to work', een bedrijf met ambitie en een sterke visie;
Een fijne sfeer binnen een organisatie die altijd in beweging is;

Word jij onze nieuwe enthousiaste BI-engineer/consultant voor Zig | Insights?


Voor het onboarden en begeleiden van nieuwe klanten op ons BI-platform Zig | Insights zijn wij op zoek naar een enthousiaste BI-engineer/consultant.

Geloof jij net als wij dat de impact van data op organisaties steeds belangrijker wordt voor het vaststellen én behalen van doelstellingen en het maken van strategische keuzes? Wil jij met data een verschil maken, onder andere voor de maatschappelijke doelstellingen van onze klanten en hun klanten? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!


Wat ga je doen

Jij speelt een belangrijke rol in het aansluiten van nieuwe klanten op ons BI-platform en het vertalen van hun wensen naar bestaande standaarden of refinements voor nieuwe standaarden. Samen met je collega’s en de klanten blijf je nieuwe informatieproducten ontwikkelen, zoals KPI’s en visualisaties in Fabric/PowerBI. Met het team (22 collega’s) optimaliseer je continu het platform met innovaties en nieuwe functionaliteiten.


Als BI-engineer/consultant ben je dagelijks bezig om samen met de klant het maximale uit de samenwerking en het BI-platform te halen. Een aantal taken en verantwoordelijkheden die bij jouw rol horen zijn:


  • Het onboarden van nieuwe klanten op het Zig | Insights platform.
  • Het begeleiden van het projectteam bij de klant in het begrijpen en integreren van definities/indicatoren vanuit de informatieproducten in de organisatieprocessen.
  • Het begeleiden van de dagstart- en dageinde-sessies met de klant en het beheer van de backlog; samen met de projectleider de voortgang bewaken.
  • Analyseren en implementeren van oplossingen om klanten te helpen bij het analyseren en rapporteren van hun data, met als doel inzicht te verkrijgen in de bedrijfsprocessen en betere datagedreven strategische beslissingen te nemen.
  • Analyseren en uitwerken van de informatiebehoefte van klanten op een duidelijke en gestructureerde manier, en deze behoeften vertalen naar gedetailleerde specificaties om oplossingen te ontwikkelen die aansluiten bij de behoeften van de klanten.
  • Het ontzorgen van de klant in het proces van data ontsluiting, data preparatie en het bouwen aan integrale informatievoorziening.
  • Fungeren als interne specialist op het gebied van business intelligence, waarbij je voortdurend de nieuwste ontwikkelingen en trends binnen dit vakgebied volgt om je deskundigheid te maximaliseren.


Dit ben jij

Jij vindt het leuk om in een team te werken dat een sterke visie heeft om de vastgoedsector via data te professionaliseren. Je hebt een passie voor data en wilt deze graag delen met klanten. Je wilt hen helpen om meer datagedreven te werken en te groeien naar een datagedreven organisatie. Jij kunt de vertaalslag maken van klantvragen naar te ontwikkelen indicatoren en dashboards.


Als BI-engineer/consultant beschik je over de volgende kennis en ervaring:

  • HBO- of WO-werk- en denkniveau (bij voorkeur in de richting bedrijfskunde, informatica, data science of toegepaste wiskunde)
  • Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring in de richting van Business Intelligence en/of data analytics
  • Ervaring met data-visualisatie-tooling (bijvoorbeeld Power BI)
  • Sterke analytische en communicatieve vaardigheden
  • Vloeiend in Nederlands, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk


Een dikke pré is als je een achtergrond of kennis hebt in finance en/of goed bent in het overzien van processen.


Wat is Zig | Insights?

Zig Insights is hét innovatieve BI-platform voor de vastgoedsector. We begeleiden organisaties bij het verwerken van data tot waardevolle informatie, op een eenduidige en gestructureerde manier, waarbij we de standaarden van de sector gebruiken. Het BI-team van Zig helpt klanten met de stappen die nodig zijn om een datagedreven cultuur te creëren.


Onze dataspecialisten hebben de drive en ambitie om zichzelf steeds opnieuw uit te vinden en werken continu aan het verbeteren en optimaliseren van producten en diensten. Samen maken we mooie dingen. De collega’s binnen het team zijn een beetje eigenwijs, hebben humor, maar houden altijd de focus op het resultaat van de klant.


Wie zijn wij?

Wij zijn Zig. We ontwikkelen software voor de vastgoedbranche (woningcorporaties, studentenhuisvesters en commercieel vastgoed) en doen dit met veel plezier.


Wij helpen organisaties om dichter bij hun klanten te komen met slimme processen, innovatieve technologieën en data. Onze digitale oplossingen zorgen ervoor dat de focus op de klant zichtbaar en voelbaar is in het complete proces: van een woning zoeken en vinden tot aan bewonen en verhuizen. Wij maken wonen makkelijker.


Dit doen wij al meer dan 14 jaar met een enthousiast team van ruim 300 specialisten die werken in Huizen, Veenendaal en hybride. Meer dan 160 vastgoedorganisaties en 1,6 miljoen mensen maken gebruik van onze software.


Dit krijg je ervoor terug


  • Wij bespreken graag jouw salariswens tijdens onze eerste kennismaking. Het salaris ligt tussen de € 4500 en € 5500 op basis van een 40-urige werkweek, afhankelijk van jouw kennis en ervaring.
  • Ruimte om mee te denken over de doorontwikkeling van onze producten en jouw kennis te delen;
  • Ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen via de Zig Academy;
  • Werken bij een 'Great place to work', een bedrijf met ambitie en een sterke visie;
  • Een fijne sfeer binnen een organisatie die altijd in beweging is;

Title: Data Analyst (Freelance)
Description:
As a Data Analyst, you will have the exciting opportunity to collaborate closely with our dynamic teams and working on multiple tasks. You will play an important role in creating engaging and insightful data visualizations using Tableau, using advanced data analysis and modelling techniques to find valuable trends and patterns within our datasets. Your involvement in developing and maintaining data models, reports, and workflows will be crucial to our success. Furthermore, you will actively engage with various business units, gaining a deep understanding of their unique needs and creating customized dashboards and solutions to meet and exceed their expectations.

About The Project

You should be already based in The Netherlands

Duration: 2-3 months

The Project Contains 2 Parts Of Development


The backend (data warehouse ) using the in-house data centre to develop a solution from data collocation to structured database (in storge ) ,
The frontend (visualisation ) : using the structured database in storge with the Tableau we cerate advance models flows in addition to build the dashboard visualizations.


What are the expectations/requirements?

You are already based in The Netherlands


Re-creation of existing dashboard and visualizations from PowerBI to tableau.
Creating data models from database using tableau Prep for visualizations
Creating new deep dives upon request
Interacting with multiple stakeholders to understand their requirements and implementing them in their dashboards
Gaid and support the stakeholders to understand and unlock the potential dashboard
Creating appealing dashboards and visualization, knowledge of UXUI would be nice


Key Responsibilities


Collaborate with the data solutions team to design, develop, and implement data-driven solutions
Create interactive and insightful data visualizations using Tableau
Perform complex data analysis and modelling to uncover trends, patterns, and insights using Tableau prep and SQL.
Assist in the development and maintenance of data pipelines and workflows
Discuss with business units (clients) to understand their needs and create dashboards tailored to their expectations
Contribute to the documentation of processes, methodologies, and best practices
Participate in team meetings, brainstorming sessions, and project planning activities


Want to know more about us?

We are serving the Swiss market as Switzerland’s leading IT & Telecom company. Thus, we are actively driving digitalization and networking, and tapping new paths for our customers and our employees. We do not know what the future is going to look like, but we definitely have the opportunity to shape it. To do so we are and act trustworthy, committed and curious.

Since 2019, we have been building up the coolest DevOps Center with a wonderful office at the World Trade Center in the heart of Rotterdam. We are currently recruiting IT passionate professionals who are keen on developing high-quality software, have an agile mindset and appreciate collaboration with motivated colleagues from all over the world.

Mylan B.V.

At VIATRIS, we see healthcare not as it is but as it should be. We act courageously and are uniquely positioned to be a source of stability in a world of evolving healthcare needs.

Access – Providing high quality trusted medicines regardless of geography or circumstance;

Leadership – Advancing sustainable operations and innovative solutions to improve patient health; and

Partnership – Leveraging our collective expertise to connect people to products and services.

Every day, we rise to the challenge to make a difference and here’s how the Business Analyst role will make an impact:

Key responsibilities for this role include:


Conduct demand forecasting analysis, collaborating with the supply chain team to optimize inventory management, production planning, and develop statistical modeling techniques to guide forecast decisions
Provide market intelligence by researching, analyzing, and interpreting data related to the pharmaceutical market, key development trends, competitor analysis, and customer preferences
Support the development and maintenance of ETL processes, ensuring accurate and timely data integration from various sources Ability to challenge contractively, while demonstrating strong understanding of the market, customers and products.
Manage master data by defining and implementing data governance policies and procedures, ensuring data quality, consistency, and integrity
Engage with stakeholders to gather business needs and requirements, translating them into functional specifications for custom solutions
Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using Power BI to deliver actionable insights and enable informed decision-making
Collaborate with European / Global analytics teams to leverage available data within the organization
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices related to business analysis, data analytics, and visualization



The minimum qualifications for this role are:


Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field. A Master's degree is a plus
Proven experience as a Business Analyst or similar role, preferably in the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry
Experience in demand forecasting, supply chain management, and market research
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, and analyze large sets of data, and present findings in a clear and concise manner and strong knowledge of MS Office programs (Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI)
Knowledge of ETL processes and data warehousing concepts
Experience with data management and analysis tools such as Excel Power Query, SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS), MS Access, any other statistical software, and BI tools
Proficiency in Power BI or similar data visualization tools to develop reports and dashboards and experience with cloud-based data platforms, such as AWS or Azure
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work independently, manage multiple priorities, and meet deadlines.
Working proficiency in English language, Dutch language is a plus.



 

At Viatris Netherlands, we offer an inclusive, engaging, and high-performing environment where you can use your experience, perspective and skills to help make an impact - come and join us!

Great Place to Work certification, demonstrating that we offer a great employee experience and being an employer of choice
Competitive compensation package inclusive of annual discretionary bonus

Title: Senior Analyst - Consumer Data
Description:
Who We Are:

Since 1906, New Balance has empowered people through sport and craftsmanship to create positive change in communities around the world. We innovate fearlessly, guided by our core values and driven by the belief that conventions were meant to be challenged. We foster a culture in which every associate feels welcomed and respected, where leaders and creatives are inspired to shape the world of tomorrow by taking bold action today. At New Balance, We Got Now.

This role will leverage our customer data warehouse, providing analytics solutions to a range of stakeholders including eCommerce, marketing, retail, planning and allocation, and strategy. Working alongside a digital analytics specialist, this role will identify new segmentation opportunities and help execute deployment across the marketing technology stack. The Sr Analyst will also be responsible for demand reporting within DTC channels and identify opportunities to improve the flow of data between systems, onboarding new sources and tools where necessary and coordinating with privacy and legal to ensure GDPR compliance.

JOB MISSION:

The Senior Analyst, Consumer Analytics will be responsible for analytics projects and customer data initiatives that leverage first-party consumer insights to drive regional business operations.

This role will leverage our customer data warehouse, providing analytics solutions to a range of stakeholders including eCommerce, marketing, retail, planning and allocation, and strategy. Working alongside a digital analytics specialist, this role will identify new segmentation opportunities and help implement deployment across the marketing technology stack. The senior analyst will also be responsible for demand reporting within DTC channels and finding opportunities to improve the flow of data between systems, onboarding new sources and tools where necessary, and coordinating with privacy and legal to ensure GDPR compliance.

MAJOR ACCOUNTABILITIES:


Conduct analyses of existing first-party customer data to deepen our connection with consumers and drive segmentation opportunities.
Work with regional partners and a global IT team to improve capabilities of customer data capture, data warehousing, and actionability of data strategy.
Create automated reporting solutions that enable more efficient ways of working for regional eCommerce teams (trading, marketing, operations).
Validate and coordinate data flows within the marketing technology stack including data warehouse, CDP, and CRM systems.
Identify new opportunities to solve regional challenges with existing customer data, and roadmap solutions to incorporate new customer data where necessary.
Translate complex analytics principles into concise, clear, and actionable outcomes.


REQUIREMENTS FOR SUCCESS:


Several years of professional experience in consumer insights, digital analytics, or business intelligence.
Strong analytical, financial, and problem-solving skills. Highly comfortable with demonstrating data to drive decisions and tell a story.
Foundational knowledge of predictive and statistical modelling techniques to segment customer data and experience using Python or R for statistical analysis.
Experience with PowerBI and DAX/M to create dashboards and reports.
Command of SQL and principles of database architecture required, with experience in Snowflake and BigQuery preferred.
Experience with a modern digital marketing technology stack.
Experience working with partners at multiple levels within an organization (operations, marketing, finance, privacy, etc.).
Willing to take action self-starter who can set strategy and drive execution with a “roll up the sleeves” approach.
Ability to translate business challenges into analytics projects and communicate insights to key partners.
Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Business Analytics, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Marketing, or a related field.
Passionate about the brand with a deep appreciation for the product and understanding of the customer’s experience.


BENEFITS:


Discretionary Bonus Opportunity
Discount on the health insurance
8% holiday allowance
Flexible Working Hours
Pension Scheme
25 days Annual Leave per year
Up to €250 travel allowance each month
Hybrid working
Employee Discount
Work from-home allowance
Home working equipment
Sports subscription via OneFit
Opportunity to work abroad for four weeks per year
Wellbeing and Mental Health Benefit (24/7 Employment Assistance Program & Support)

Title: Data analyst
Description:
As a Data Analyst at Newcraft you’ll delve into the data of our A-brand clients in order to improve their channel conversions. You’re a crucial link in the digital acceleration of our top brand clients.

What You’ll Be Working On

Together with your fellow Commerce team members, you will make sure our clients achieve digital growth. You will collect and analyze quantitative and qualitative data to discover opportunities that improve the online customer journey. In this process, you collaborate closely with the client to ensure that your knowledge and skills are effectively transferred.

Your Responsibilities


Collect, plan and execute data driven online optimization programs.
Initiate hypothesis-driven A/B tests with the aim of improving visitor to buyer conversion.
Translate data into comprehensible visualizations using Google Analytics, Tableau or a similar program.
Advise and convince teams at every level.
Create and guide implementation of measurement plans for both web and app.
Involving various teams in your optimization plans, regardless of their level of digital maturity.


Qualifications


A background of 1-3 years in analytics in a commercial online setting.
Proficiency in SQL, BigQuery, Python, or R, and a strong inclination toward these technologies.
Familiarity with the Google Marketing Platform, including GA4, Google Tag Manager, and Looker Studio is beneficial.
Bonus points for experience in A/B testing and familiarity with customer feedback tools like Optimizely, VWO, Hotjar, or Usabilla.
If you know your way around visualisation tools like PowerBI or Tableau, that would make you a superstar.


Who You Are


Proactive, analytical and eager to learn.
Self-starting.
Good communication skills; you can translate complex data into a comprehensive story.
Fluent in Dutch and English.


About Us

At Newcraft, you will be working in a stimulating environment where you can collaborate with colleagues to improve and optimize client campaigns. We encourage continuous growth and development and expect you to stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the email marketing world.

Together, you’ll make a difference, and enjoyment is an integral part of the job. We’re passionate about what we do, about each other, and for whom we work.

Your Responsibilities

  • Collect, plan and execute data driven online optimization programs.
  • Initiate hypothesis-driven A/B tests with the aim of improving visitor to buyer conversion.
  • Translate data into comprehensible visualizations using Google Analytics, Tableau or a similar program.
  • Advise and convince teams at every level.
  • Create and guide implementation of measurement plans for both web and app.
  • Involving various teams in your optimization plans, regardless of their level of digital maturity.

Qualifications

  • A background of 1-3 years in analytics in a commercial online setting.
  • Proficiency in SQL, BigQuery, Python, or R, and a strong inclination toward these technologies.
  • Familiarity with the Google Marketing Platform, including GA4, Google Tag Manager, and Looker Studio is beneficial.
  • Bonus points for experience in A/B testing and familiarity with customer feedback tools like Optimizely, VWO, Hotjar, or Usabilla.
  • If you know your way around visualisation tools like PowerBI or Tableau, that would make you a superstar.

Who You Are

  • Proactive, analytical and eager to learn.
  • Self-starting.
  • Good communication skills; you can translate complex data into a comprehensive story.
  • Fluent in Dutch and English.

About Us

At Newcraft, you will be working in a stimulating environment where you can collaborate with colleagues to improve and optimize client campaigns. We encourage continuous growth and development and expect you to stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the email marketing world.

Together, you’ll make a difference, and enjoyment is an integral part of the job. We’re passionate about what we do, about each other, and for whom we work.

Title: ABN AMRO Traineeship - Data Analyst
HTML:
At a glance

As a data analyst trainee you will learn how to sift through data and seek to identify trends. What stories do the numbers tell? What business decisions can be made based on these insights? See yourself as a consultant between the data and a business line. As a data analyst you may also create visual representations, such as dashboards, charts and graphs to better showcase what the data reveals. With this Traineeship you will take the first step in your career as a data analyst to develop yourself personally and professionally!

Your job

  • Conduct consumer/business data research and analytics;
  • Extract actionable insights from large databases;
  • Perform recurring and ad hoc quantitative analysis to support day-to-day decision making;
  • Support reporting and analytics, such as KPIs, financial reports, and creating and improving dashboards;
  • Help translate data into visualizations, metrics, and goals.


Your profile

As a data analyst trainee you should have a degree in mathematics, statistics, physics, econometrics or business, with an analytics focus. You must have strong skills in math, science, programming, databases, modelling, and predictive analytics.

Who are you?

  • Entrepreneurial spirit, creative mind-set and capable of assessing and evaluating risks;
  • Knowledge of or at least interested in technology and how this supports business improvements;
  • Thrives in an international context;
  • Thinks in terms of what’s possible, sees opportunities and takes a solutions-oriented approach;
  • Self-starter who readily assumes responsibility;
  • You have a valid EU work permit.


What’s your experience?

  • Experience working with R or Python;
  • Experience working with SQL;
  • A strong combination of analytical skills, intellectual curiosity, and reporting skills;
  • Experience visualizing and presenting data, e.g. PowerBI;
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills;
  • A proactive approach, with an ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously;
  • No more than 2 years of work experience (internships do not count as work experience), this is a graduate programme.


Nice to have:

  • A basic understanding of cloud technology;
  • A basic understanding of data mining techniques, emerging technologies (MapReduce, Spark, large-scale data frameworks, machine learning, neural networks);
  • Familiarity with the Agile methodology.


What We Offer

In our Data Traineeship, we prepare you to become a Data Expert who is not only relevant today but also prepared for the challenges of tomorrow and beyond. This program offers a balanced blend of professional and personal development training. Our commitment to your growth extends beyond the traineeship, as we continue to invest in your long-term career and provide guidance throughout your journey within the bank.

Moreover, our Data Strategy at ABN AMRO is focused on harnessing the power of data to drive insightful decision-making, enhance customer experiences, and maintain our competitive edge in the market. By integrating this strategy into our traineeship, we ensure that you not only gain practical skills but also understand the strategic importance of data in driving business success.

We are currently designing an entirely new program, so we can’t provide detailed specifics just yet. However, there’s no need to worry—exciting themes abound! Imagine engaging in enriching training sessions and masterclasses on cutting-edge topics like AI and Sustainability, as well as Leadership. You’ll be supported by a coach and mentor to ensure you receive the guidance you need.

What’s more, you won’t be confined to just one department within the bank. We want you to experience the breadth of our organization, which is why you’ll participate in multiple project rotations. This dynamic approach will allow you to gain a comprehensive understanding of our bank and develop a diverse skill set. Get ready for a journey filled with opportunities for growth, learning, and making meaningful contributions!

Interested?

Are you interested? Apply via the button above and upload your resume and cover letter. Do not apply for more than one position within the Data Traineeship, so choose between the Data Analyst and Data Scientist position. We are looking for graduates with a strong motivation to work for ABN AMRO. The Data Traineeship program starts in January 2025, it is possible to start working earlier with your team before the courses start in order to become acquainted with your new environment.

Selection process

After you apply you will receive an e-mail within 10 working days to let you know if you have been selected and can move forward to the next round. The overall recruitment process includes:

  • Apply online with your CV and cover letter;
  • CV screening by recruitment;
  • Online capacity test;
  • CV screening by hiring manager;
  • Online interview and case presentation by candidate;
  • Second interview;
  • Job offer.


If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at werkenbij@nl.abnamro.com.

Equal opportunities for all

The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

Disclaimer external recruitment agencies

External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. In addition, a recruitment agency can only submit a resume when invited by a Talent Acquisition Specialist to join the search for a right candidate. All unsolicited resumes sent to us will be considered property of ABN AMRO BANK N.V. In this case, ABN AMRO will not be held liable to pay a placement fee.

Wij bieden

  • Een leergierige houding
  • Analytische skills

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
(Fulltime, 38hrs per week)

About The Job

Do you want to work for a highly successful, fast expanding international retailer with many growth opportunities? At Action we offer you the opportunity to become part of our newly created Strategy and Analytics team as Data Analyst and play an important role in supporting the overall growth of Action.

This is your daily action

The Data Analyst is part of the Business Development Team and reports to the Head of Business Development. Together with senior executives, the Strategy and Analytics team works on key topics for Action such as: Sustainability, Digitization, Expansion, Supply Chain and more. Together with your team members you support in driving data-driven decision-making across the organization.

Your work field is very dynamic, but in general involves tasks such as:


Build deep insights and analysis regarding the dynamic and competitive landscape in which we operate.
Work with our internal data and external market data to discover insights, converting these into tangible business recommendations that support our strategy.
Lead and participate in strategic projects, in close collaboration with your colleagues from the Strategy and Analytics Team and the Action team at large.
Support operational departments in root cause analyses and understanding performance issues


Your work location will be our International Head Office in Zwaagdijk (a 30 minutes traffic free drive from Amsterdam).

This is you

What you bring:


Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Familiarity with retail analytics, including sales forecasting, inventory, and customer behavior analysis.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in data analysis or a related field.
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.


What we offer

Surprisingly much! From our international headquarters in the Netherlands you have an impact on what happens in our stores across Europe. We welcome more than 15 million customers every week in more than 2,600 stores in 12 European countries. We have great growth ambitions. For Action and for you. Because our growth means that you can always take new steps. A different position, an interesting innovation project, new skills: you can continue to develop as a professional. And all this in a culture where our shared values are truly lived: customer focus, teamwork, simplicity, discipline, cost conscious and respect

Did you know that you can also count on us for:


A competitive salary based on a 38-hour working week
24 paid vacation days with the option of purchasing 5 extra days (based on 38 hours per week).
A temporary contract with the intention of offering you a permanent contract in the long term
Flexible working hours
15% employee discount on your purchases at Action
A good pension scheme and collective health insurance


How we contribute to society

If you only know Action from the stores, a world will open up for you when you come and work with us. We work hard to make a positive impact on society and the environment. Did you know, for example, that we sponsor more than 2,500 children worldwide who grow up in an SOS Children's Village? That our team reflects the diversity of our customers, including 155 different nationalities? That we purchase 94% of our wood products and 100% of our cotton sustainably? And that almost all our stores only use energy-efficient LED lighting? Yes, that is also Action. Curious about what other initiatives we’re facilitating? Join our team and find out for yourself.

Interested?

Take action and apply now!

The next steps


Our recruiter will review your application and get back to you as soon as possible.
We invite you for a first job interview.
We would like to get to know you better, which is why we ask you to take an online assessment.
We will invite you for a second interview and we will discuss your assessment.
Are we still a great match? Then we will become new colleagues!


At Action, integrity is of great importance to us. A pre-employment screening is therefore part of the application process for this vacancy. Contact your recruiter for more information.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Kom jij onze klanten adviseren en helpen met het bouwen van rapportages in Power BI? Wil jij klanten ondersteunen bij het vertalen van data naar overzichtelijke rapporten? We zijn op zoek naar een Data Analist die energie krijgt van het helpen van organisaties om vooruit te kijken door middel van Business Intelligence. Werk je graag met Microsoft-technologieën zoals Azure, Fabric en Power BI, en denk je graag mee met klanten over hun informatiebehoefte? Ben je in staat om data te visualiseren in een dashboard? Dan is de rol van Data Analist perfect voor jou!




Dit mag je van ons verwachten

Je verdient tussen de €4.200 - €5.800. Ook kun je extra bonussen ontvangen, afhankelijk van jouw prestaties en die van de organisatie.
We faciliteren je in een werkplek waar je altijd en overal kan werken. Thuis, op kantoor in Bunnik of bij één van de andere bedrijven van Axelio. Zo voel je je overal thuis.
Wij stimuleren jou om in jezelf te investeren en jezelf te ontwikkelen. Per jaar investeren we 10 dagen die je kan inzetten voor studie & trainingen.
Wij bieden jou een mobiliteitsbudget dat je kan inzetten voor een leaseauto, een leasefiets, het openbaar vervoer of kan laten uitkeren als een bruto vergoeding.
Bij iqbs krijg je 28 vakantiedagen en heb je de mogelijkheid om extra dagen bij te kopen maar ook om dagen te verkopen. Flexibiliteit die past bij jouw situatie.
Bij iqbs is werken meer dan jouw functie goed uitoefenen. We hechten veel waarde aan een goede sfeer en organiseren regelmatig gezellige borrels en teamuitjes.




Dit ga je doen als Data Analist

Als Data Analist voer je zelfstandig je werkzaamheden uit en draag je de verantwoordelijkheid voor het uitvoeren van projecten. Je speelt een sleutelrol in het ondersteunen van onze klanten bij het nemen van datagedreven beslissingen. Je werkt nauw samen met verschillende afdelingen en stakeholders om hun informatiebehoeften te begrijpen en te vertalen naar concrete analyses en dashboards. Jouw analyses helpen onze klanten vooruit te kijken en strategische keuzes te maken. Bovendien neem je een junior collega op sleeptouw, waarbij je jouw kennis en ervaring deelt om gezamenlijk succesvolle resultaten te behalen.




Jouw werkzaamheden:

Het inzichtelijk maken van data met behulp van Microsoft-oplossingen zodat dit sprekende informatie wordt.
Analyseren van gegevens en de klant helpen business vraagstukken op te lossen.
Bepalen van KPI’s en op basis daarvan rapporten bouwen die de gegevens visualiseren.
Adviseren, begeleiden en doorvragen om Business Intelligence volledig te integreren en de echte behoeften van de klant naar boven te halen.
Begrijpen, ontwerpen en optimaliseren van datamodellen, rapportages en dashboards met tools als Azure, Fabric en Power BI.




Dit verwachten we van jou

Minimaal een hbo-opleiding in Informatica, (Technische) Bedrijfskunde of ICT.
Je kunt je verplaatsen in het probleem van de klant en (samen met je collega’s) op zoek te gaan naar de beste oplossing.
Bereidheid om af en toe te reizen in binnen- en buitenland.
Goede kennis van bedrijfsprocessen.
Ervaring met Power BI en datamodellering.
Vaardig in het visualiseren van data.
Certificaten in Microsoft BI stack of bereidheid om deze te behalen.
Creativiteit in het vinden van de beste oplossing voor de klant.
Uitstekende beheersing van zowel de Nederlandse als Engelse taal, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.




Over iqbs

Met meer dan 15 jaar ervaring hebben we uitgebreide kennis opgebouwd in het ontsluiten van ERP-systemen, het ontwikkelen van een eigen datawarehouse en het bouwen van dashboards. Dit wordt allemaal ondersteund door automatiseringen binnen ons eigen framework. Iqbs heeft uitgebreide ervaring met het toegankelijk maken van data uit ERP-systemen zoals Business Central, Infor, SAP en Odoo. Bovendien bieden wij organisaties ondersteuning met trainingen en het beantwoorden van specifieke vragen, zoals het ontsluiten van data uit verschillende bronnen.




Je gaat aan de slag in een team van professionals, die elke dag werken om leads en klanten mee te nemen in de kansen die Data Analytics, Business Intelligence en Cloud hen bieden. Bedrijven en mensen die aan de slag willen met Power BI komen veelal via een korte online zoektocht bij ons uit. Het is aan jou om door goede kwalificatie van de leads die projecten te spotten waar de complexere datavraagstukken liggen. Dat is waar we goed in zijn, dat is waar we blij van worden.




Als onderdeel van Axelio profiteer je van alle kansen die het werken bij een groep biedt.

Title: Marketing Data Analist
Description:
Ben jij iemand die enthousiast wordt van marketing data? Iemand die uit complexe data de juiste inzichten kan halen? En heb je ervaring met Excel en PowerBI? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!




Bij Dunck Loyalty in Utrecht krijg je als Marketing Data Analist een unieke kans om jouw analytische vaardigheden volledig in te zetten. Je gaat aan de slag met een breed scala aan projecten voor A-merk opdrachtgevers – van verenigingen en goede doelen tot commerciële B2B- en B2C-bedrijven. Geen dag is hetzelfde!




Wat ga je doen?

Als Marketing Data Analist bij Dunck Loyalty duik je in de wereld van klantdata. Jij weet hoe je uit grote hoeveelheden marketing data de juiste inzichten haalt en deze aansprekend en begrijpelijk weergeeft in PowerPoint en/of PowerBI.




Je dagelijkse werkzaamheden bestaan uit:

Meedenken over relevante klantdata-analyses en dashboards voor onze toonaangevende opdrachtgevers
Uitvoeren van complexe klantdata-analyses in Excel, SPSS, PowerBI
Ontwikkelen, uitbreiden en updaten van loyalty dashboards en marketing programma dashboards in PowerBI
Ondersteunen bij de uitvoering van kwantitatieve (en evt. kwalitatieve) marketing onderzoeken
Vertalen van diverse inzichten naar concrete conclusies en aanbevelingen
Bijdragen aan de ontwikkeling en standaardisatie van insights oplossingen




Wat neem je mee?

Een studie op Universitair niveau in een relevante richting
Tot 5 jaar werkervaring
Een passie voor data en een scherp oog voor detail
Het vermogen om uit grote hoeveelheden data de juiste inzichten te halen
Ervaring met Excel en PowerBI (eventueel ook met SPSS)
Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal
Energie en doorzettingsvermogen




Wat bieden we jou?

Een hele leuke en uitdagende baan bij dé toonaangevende partij in Nederland op het gebied van Loyalty Marketing. Je salaris is aantrekkelijk en sluit aan bij de kennis en ervaring die je meebrengt.




Secundaire voorwaarden o.a.:

Ruimte en aandacht voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling door opleiding, coaching, literatuur, events en inspiratie vanuit collega’s
Een professionele en informele werksfeer met gezamenlijke lunches, inspiratiesessies en borrels
Veel ruimte om je professionele netwerk uit te breiden en jezelf te ontwikkelen als expert op het gebied van loyalty en marketing insights




Dunck bestaat uit een team van gedreven marketing professionals. We zijn trots op wat we doen en hebben daar veel plezier in. Wij werken vanuit een stimulerende omgeving in Utrecht en maken grote groeistappen. Jouw energie en talent zal bij ons floreren!




Vragen of reageren?

Op de website van Dunck (www.dunck.nl) staat nog meer informatie over de vacature. Voor inhoudelijke vragen over de vacature kun je ook contact opnemen met Rob Horsten via 030-2347130. Direct solliciteren? Stuur dan je CV (en motivatie) vóór 7 oktober 2024 naar sollicitatie@dunck.nl.




Over Dunck

Dunck is gespecialiseerd en toonaangevend in Loyalty Marketing. Wij helpen onze opdrachtgevers bij het stimuleren van klantloyaliteit. Dit doen wij middels een compleet scala aan slimme en innovatieve marketingoplossingen, die wij inzetten voor vele bekende organisaties zoals Accor Hotels, Vereniging Eigen Huis, Greenpeace, FNV, Unicef, Hartstichting, DHL en ANWB.
