Description:
Who We Are:

Since 1906, New Balance has empowered people through sport and craftsmanship to create positive change in communities around the world. We innovate fearlessly, guided by our core values and driven by the belief that conventions were meant to be challenged. We foster a culture in which every associate feels welcomed and respected, where leaders and creatives are inspired to shape the world of tomorrow by taking bold action today. At New Balance, We Got Now.

This role will leverage our customer data warehouse, providing analytics solutions to a range of stakeholders including eCommerce, marketing, retail, planning and allocation, and strategy. Working alongside a digital analytics specialist, this role will identify new segmentation opportunities and help execute deployment across the marketing technology stack. The Sr Analyst will also be responsible for demand reporting within DTC channels and identify opportunities to improve the flow of data between systems, onboarding new sources and tools where necessary and coordinating with privacy and legal to ensure GDPR compliance.

JOB MISSION:

The Senior Analyst, Consumer Analytics will be responsible for analytics projects and customer data initiatives that leverage first-party consumer insights to drive regional business operations.

This role will leverage our customer data warehouse, providing analytics solutions to a range of stakeholders including eCommerce, marketing, retail, planning and allocation, and strategy. Working alongside a digital analytics specialist, this role will identify new segmentation opportunities and help implement deployment across the marketing technology stack. The senior analyst will also be responsible for demand reporting within DTC channels and finding opportunities to improve the flow of data between systems, onboarding new sources and tools where necessary, and coordinating with privacy and legal to ensure GDPR compliance.

MAJOR ACCOUNTABILITIES:


Conduct analyses of existing first-party customer data to deepen our connection with consumers and drive segmentation opportunities.
Work with regional partners and a global IT team to improve capabilities of customer data capture, data warehousing, and actionability of data strategy.
Create automated reporting solutions that enable more efficient ways of working for regional eCommerce teams (trading, marketing, operations).
Validate and coordinate data flows within the marketing technology stack including data warehouse, CDP, and CRM systems.
Identify new opportunities to solve regional challenges with existing customer data, and roadmap solutions to incorporate new customer data where necessary.
Translate complex analytics principles into concise, clear, and actionable outcomes.


REQUIREMENTS FOR SUCCESS:


Several years of professional experience in consumer insights, digital analytics, or business intelligence.
Strong analytical, financial, and problem-solving skills. Highly comfortable with demonstrating data to drive decisions and tell a story.
Foundational knowledge of predictive and statistical modelling techniques to segment customer data and experience using Python or R for statistical analysis.
Experience with PowerBI and DAX/M to create dashboards and reports.
Command of SQL and principles of database architecture required, with experience in Snowflake and BigQuery preferred.
Experience with a modern digital marketing technology stack.
Experience working with partners at multiple levels within an organization (operations, marketing, finance, privacy, etc.).

Ability to translate business challenges into analytics projects and communicate insights to key partners.
Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Business Analytics, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Marketing, or a related field.
Passionate about the brand with a deep appreciation for the product and understanding of the customer’s experience.

Title: Data analyst
Description:
As a Data Analyst at Newcraft you’ll delve into the data of our A-brand clients in order to improve their channel conversions. You’re a crucial link in the digital acceleration of our top brand clients.

What You’ll Be Working On

Together with your fellow Commerce team members, you will make sure our clients achieve digital growth. You will collect and analyze quantitative and qualitative data to discover opportunities that improve the online customer journey. In this process, you collaborate closely with the client to ensure that your knowledge and skills are effectively transferred.

Your Responsibilities


Collect, plan and execute data driven online optimization programs.
Initiate hypothesis-driven A/B tests with the aim of improving visitor to buyer conversion.
Translate data into comprehensible visualizations using Google Analytics, Tableau or a similar program.
Advise and convince teams at every level.
Create and guide implementation of measurement plans for both web and app.
Involving various teams in your optimization plans, regardless of their level of digital maturity.


Qualifications


A background of 1-3 years in analytics in a commercial online setting.
Proficiency in SQL, BigQuery, Python, or R, and a strong inclination toward these technologies.
Familiarity with the Google Marketing Platform, including GA4, Google Tag Manager, and Looker Studio is beneficial.
Bonus points for experience in A/B testing and familiarity with customer feedback tools like Optimizely, VWO, Hotjar, or Usabilla.
If you know your way around visualisation tools like PowerBI or Tableau, that would make you a superstar.


Who You Are


Proactive, analytical and eager to learn.
Self-starting.
Good communication skills; you can translate complex data into a comprehensive story.
Fluent in Dutch and English.


About Us

At Newcraft, you will be working in a stimulating environment where you can collaborate with colleagues to improve and optimize client campaigns. We encourage continuous growth and development and expect you to stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the email marketing world.

Together, you’ll make a difference, and enjoyment is an integral part of the job. We’re passionate about what we do, about each other, and for whom we work.

Title: ABN AMRO Traineeship - Data Analyst
HTML:
At a glance

As a data analyst trainee you will learn how to sift through data and seek to identify trends. What stories do the numbers tell? What business decisions can be made based on these insights? See yourself as a consultant between the data and a business line. As a data analyst you may also create visual representations, such as dashboards, charts and graphs to better showcase what the data reveals. With this Traineeship you will take the first step in your career as a data analyst to develop yourself personally and professionally!

Your job

  • Conduct consumer/business data research and analytics;
  • Extract actionable insights from large databases;
  • Perform recurring and ad hoc quantitative analysis to support day-to-day decision making;
  • Support reporting and analytics, such as KPIs, financial reports, and creating and improving dashboards;
  • Help translate data into visualizations, metrics, and goals.


Your profile

As a data analyst trainee you should have a degree in mathematics, statistics, physics, econometrics or business, with an analytics focus. You must have strong skills in math, science, programming, databases, modelling, and predictive analytics.

Who are you?

  • Entrepreneurial spirit, creative mind-set and capable of assessing and evaluating risks;
  • Knowledge of or at least interested in technology and how this supports business improvements;
  • Thrives in an international context;
  • Thinks in terms of what’s possible, sees opportunities and takes a solutions-oriented approach;
  • Self-starter who readily assumes responsibility;
  • You have a valid EU work permit.


What’s your experience?

  • Experience working with R or Python;
  • Experience working with SQL;
  • A strong combination of analytical skills, intellectual curiosity, and reporting skills;
  • Experience visualizing and presenting data, e.g. PowerBI;
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills;
  • A proactive approach, with an ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously;
  • No more than 2 years of work experience (internships do not count as work experience), this is a graduate programme.


Nice to have:

  • A basic understanding of cloud technology;
  • A basic understanding of data mining techniques, emerging technologies (MapReduce, Spark, large-scale data frameworks, machine learning, neural networks);
  • Familiarity with the Agile methodology.

In our Data Traineeship, we prepare you to become a Data Expert who is not only relevant today but also prepared for the challenges of tomorrow and beyond. This program offers a balanced blend of professional and personal development training. Our commitment to your growth extends beyond the traineeship, as we continue to invest in your long-term career and provide guidance throughout your journey within the bank.

Moreover, our Data Strategy at ABN AMRO is focused on harnessing the power of data to drive insightful decision-making, enhance customer experiences, and maintain our competitive edge in the market. By integrating this strategy into our traineeship, we ensure that you not only gain practical skills but also understand the strategic importance of data in driving business success.

We are currently designing an entirely new program, so we can’t provide detailed specifics just yet. However, there’s no need to worry—exciting themes abound! Imagine engaging in enriching training sessions and masterclasses on cutting-edge topics like AI and Sustainability, as well as Leadership. You’ll be supported by a coach and mentor to ensure you receive the guidance you need.

What’s more, you won’t be confined to just one department within the bank. We want you to experience the breadth of our organization, which is why you’ll participate in multiple project rotations. This dynamic approach will allow you to gain a comprehensive understanding of our bank and develop a diverse skill set. Get ready for a journey filled with opportunities for growth, learning, and making meaningful contributions!

Interested?

Are you interested? Apply via the button above and upload your resume and cover letter. Do not apply for more than one position within the Data Traineeship, so choose between the Data Analyst and Data Scientist position. We are looking for graduates with a strong motivation to work for ABN AMRO. The Data Traineeship program starts in January 2025, it is possible to start working earlier with your team before the courses start in order to become acquainted with your new environment.

After you apply you will receive an e-mail within 10 working days to let you know if you have been selected and can move forward to the next round. The overall recruitment process includes:

Bij Dunck Loyalty in Utrecht krijg je als Marketing Data Analist een unieke kans om jouw analytische vaardigheden volledig in te zetten. Als Marketing Data Analist bij Dunck Loyalty duik je in de wereld van klantdata. Jij weet hoe je uit grote hoeveelheden marketing data de juiste inzichten haalt en deze aansprekend en begrijpelijk weergeeft in PowerPoint en/of PowerBI.

Meedenken over relevante klantdata-analyses en dashboards voor onze toonaangevende opdrachtgevers
Uitvoeren van complexe klantdata-analyses in Excel, SPSS, PowerBI
Ontwikkelen, uitbreiden en updaten van loyalty dashboards en marketing programma dashboards in PowerBI
Ondersteunen bij de uitvoering van kwantitatieve (en evt. kwalitatieve) marketing onderzoeken
Vertalen van diverse inzichten naar concrete conclusies en aanbevelingen
Bijdragen aan de ontwikkeling en standaardisatie van insights oplossingen




Wat neem je mee?

Een studie op Universitair niveau in een relevante richting
Tot 5 jaar werkervaring
Een passie voor data en een scherp oog voor detail
Het vermogen om uit grote hoeveelheden data de juiste inzichten te halen
Ervaring met Excel en PowerBI (eventueel ook met SPSS)
Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal
Energie en doorzettingsvermogen




Wat bieden we jou?

Een hele leuke en uitdagende baan bij dé toonaangevende partij in Nederland op het gebied van Loyalty Marketing. Je salaris is aantrekkelijk en sluit aan bij de kennis en ervaring die je meebrengt.




Secundaire voorwaarden o.a.:

Ruimte en aandacht voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling door opleiding, coaching, literatuur, events en inspiratie vanuit collega’s
Een professionele en informele werksfeer met gezamenlijke lunches, inspiratiesessies en borrels
Veel ruimte om je professionele netwerk uit te breiden en jezelf te ontwikkelen als expert op het gebied van loyalty en marketing insights




Dunck bestaat uit een team van gedreven marketing professionals. We zijn trots op wat we doen en hebben daar veel plezier in. Wij werken vanuit een stimulerende omgeving in Utrecht en maken grote groeistappen. Jouw energie en talent zal bij ons floreren!

Dunck is gespecialiseerd en toonaangevend in Loyalty Marketing. Wij helpen onze opdrachtgevers bij het stimuleren van klantloyaliteit. Dit doen wij middels een compleet scala aan slimme en innovatieve marketingoplossingen, die wij inzetten voor vele bekende organisaties zoals Accor Hotels, Vereniging Eigen Huis, Greenpeace, FNV, Unicef, Hartstichting, DHL en ANWB.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have experience with data analysis, data mining, and ability to design and build data reporting tools? Are you looking for the opportunity to use your analytical skills and structured mindset in order to support Pandora's strategy? And, do you want to work in vibrant team with passionate and can-do people? Then, keep on reading!

About The Role

We are seeking Data Analyst who works on the highest level of abstraction of the data stack, interprets data and turns it into information which can offer ways to improve business, thus affecting business decisions.

The Data Analyst will be playing a key role in the Merchandising product line of the global Data & Analytics organization ensuring business outcomes through close collaboration with stakeholders in Merchandising and Integrated Planning. Your role will be instrumental in delivering insights and analytical use cases for key business stakeholders, senior management, and internal counterparts.

You will work on analytical deliverables supporting Pandora's strategy, enhancing our global merchandising data foundation, building insights through analysis. More specifically, your responsibilities will include:


Working closely with the Data & Analytics Product Manager, Business Analysts, Data Scientists, and Data & Analytics Engineering team to build insights and products that provide business opportunities and areas of improvement. You will translate business challenges and opportunities into analytics and insights for the business or data and analytical products that create an impact.
Engaging with the business and facilitating data storytelling and insights as part of agile sprint sessions. You will map the insights and deliverables to priority and time constraints.
Collaborating closely with function area users across the organization to understand use case requirements and ensure that solutions align with business needs and Pandora's strategy.
Creating and maintaining the logic and processes to support trustworthy and efficient consumption of business data.
Investigating data sources across enterprise and expanding existing search data infrastructure, identifying opportunities to expand modelling.
Identifying, developing, managing, and executing analyses to uncover areas of opportunity and present written business recommendations.
Developing and implementing data strategies, data quality assurance and data operating model aligned with the D&A Strategy.
Conducting data assessments and audits to identify new target and opportunities for improvement.



In order to succeed, we expect that you have and can demonstrate:


Bachelors (or relevant work experience) in a quantitative discipline like Computer science, Statistics, Mathematics, engineering etc.
3+ years of professional experience in business intelligence, data modelling and advanced business analytics. 2+ years of SQL and experience with efficient processing of large data sets.
Experience in data analysis and visualization, using tools such as SQL, Python, R, Tableau, or Power BI. Experience in data mining and using databases in a business environment with big data technologies and large-scale, complex datasets. Prior experience with Microservice, Data pipelines and Event Driven architecture is a plus.
Experience in designing and building data infrastructure/automated reporting tools.
Ability to give definition to ambiguous problems, as well as to work independently.
Strong problem-solving skills, analytical mindset, and stakeholder management skills.
Engligh fluency at a professional level, both verbal and written.
Experience planning and executing in an agile framework would be a plus.
Demonstrated ability to build a story around the data and convey the findings of the analysis to several stakeholders.
Strong team player who takes ownership, and ultimately focused on delivering results with high standards.



Your New Team

Welcome to the Global Data & Analytics in Digital & Tech at Pandora – the world’s largest jewellery brand. We are a passionate group of Data and Analytics professionals collaborating with Business functions to build a data-centric organization. Our team manages a broad suite of Data & Analytics products and aims to expand to enable the strategy of putting data at the heart of Pandora. Your new team consists of a diverse and enthusiastic group of product and delivery professionals who, together with architects and engineers, share a joint mission. We are passionate about value and outcomes and pursue agile ways of working and strong collaboration to achieve this while having fun.

Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Kelly Kavarnou

Global Tech Recruiter

kekav@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We are an international team, so please make sure to send us your application in English to be considered. We look forward to hearing from you! We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Digital & Technology Hub in Copenhagen, rapidly growing environment of highly skilled and experienced colleagues. Which is a key initiative that goes along with Pandora’s experience & ambitions.

You will also be able to take part in creating eco-friendly environment – that we are not only talking about – but implementing. The result is a professional and dynamic environment that is unique, enjoyable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

  • Conducting data assessments and audits to identify new target and opportunities for improvement.

  • Bachelors (or relevant work experience) in a quantitative discipline like Computer science, Statistics, Mathematics, engineering etc.
  • 3+ years of professional experience in business intelligence, data modelling and advanced business analytics. 2+ years of SQL and experience with efficient processing of large data sets.
  • Experience in data analysis and visualization, using tools such as SQL, Python, R, Tableau, or Power BI. Experience in data mining and using databases in a business environment with big data technologies and large-scale, complex datasets. Prior experience with Microservice, Data pipelines and Event Driven architecture is a plus.
  • Experience in designing and building data infrastructure/automated reporting tools.
  • Ability to give definition to ambiguous problems, as well as to work independently.
  • Strong problem-solving skills, analytical mindset, and stakeholder management skills.
  • Engligh fluency at a professional level, both verbal and written.
  • Experience planning and executing in an agile framework would be a plus.
  • Demonstrated ability to build a story around the data and convey the findings of the analysis to several stakeholders.

Your New Team

Welcome to the Global Data & Analytics in Digital & Tech at Pandora – the world’s largest jewellery brand. We are a passionate group of Data and Analytics professionals collaborating with Business functions to build a data-centric organization. Our team manages a broad suite of Data & Analytics products and aims to expand to enable the strategy of putting data at the heart of Pandora. Your new team consists of a diverse and enthusiastic group of product and delivery professionals who, together with architects and engineers, share a joint mission. Did we get your attention?

Kelly Kavarnou

Global Tech Recruiter

kekav@pandora.net

Title: (Junior) Specialist (m/f/d) - Data Analytics & Insights Team
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Country

Denmark

Job Family

Client Solutions

Our Mission

At Consumer Panel Services GfK, our mission is clear: to provide key information on who buys what, where, how much, how often, and most importantly, why (or why not). We take pride in delivering high-quality, uninterrupted data, expert consultancy, and unparalleled expertise to empower our clients to deliver superior customer experiences at every stage of the shopper journey.

Job Description

We have one goal: To support our customers in strengthening their market position.

In continuous consumer research, we collect and analyse the purchasing behaviour of consumers within the FMCG market. This gives us important information about which purchasing decisions consumers make and how behaviour changes over time. In this way, the consumer panel explains how and when markets and brands change. For them we make predictions for tomorrow so that they can make the right decisions today. Through our data analysis, we filter out and structure the relevant information, we ensure that our customers from trade and industry recognize the right signals that are for them in the flood of data and thus support e.g. marketing strategies.

The (Junior) Specialist (m/f/d) sits within our Data Analytics & Insights Team in Consumer Panel Services and is responsible for research design, project proposal as well as ad hoc data analysis and reporting for our Nordic clients. The (Junior) Specialist is able to take a large amount of data, structure it according to it each case, and built up a relevant storyline for the client in collaboration with the responsible consultants for each client. Reporting to our Director Data Analytics & Insights Team based in Germany the (Junior) Specialist will have an autonomous approach to their work but also benefit from close collaboration with consulting, commercial and operational colleagues across the Nordic region.

Purpose of the Role

The purpose of the role may vary depending on the candidate scope but ideally to include:


Define adequate analyses design
Structuring data and build up a relevant storyline
Responsible for providing all types of insight deliveries to clients
Build solutions colleges and clients can benefit from
Constantly improving our data and add process quality
Provides input for designing statistical analyses and setting up efficient processes
If applicable: is responsible for project management tasks
Proactive and independent problem solving (finds solutions for business problems), not just execution of tasks!


Key Activities

Research Design & Proposal Development


Create and adapt adequate research design
Provides input for designing statistical analyses and setting up efficient processes


Analysis and reporting


Create in-depth client studies for reporting purposes or detailed customer requests
Analyse data and trends in data using various tools in order to generate insights for the client
Develop presentation charts and client reports with corresponding insights which reply the client’s questions; utilization of fact-based-consultancy
Promote automation processes and develops efficient ways to create client deliverables such as excel tables, PPT slides and internal programmes you will learn to use


Client Management


To some extent have client interaction and act as an expert in the analysis we make for them
Being in charge of delivering monthly/quarterly/annual reports to clients


Requirements


Reading and understanding either Danish or Swedish
English language skills - B2 min.
An advantage with skills in Excel and PPT
The motivation to take a large amount of data, structure it and make a universe for many kinds of clients
Eager to learn our internal data analysis programmes
Ideally able to work in our Copenhagen office. Otherwise work from our Stockholm office as an alternative


We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. We make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions.

(Junior) Specialist (m/k/d) – Data Analytics & Insights Team

Job beskrivelse

Vi har ét mål: At støtte vores kunder i at styrke deres markedsposition.

I løbende forbrugerundersøgelser indsamler og analyserer vi forbrugernes købsadfærd inden for FMCG-markedet. Dette giver os vigtig information om, hvilke købsbeslutninger forbrugerne træffer, og hvordan adfærd ændrer sig over tid. På den måde identificerer forbrugerpanelet, hvordan og hvornår markeder og brands ændrer sig. For kunderne laver vi morgendagens forudsigelser, så de kan træffe de rigtige beslutninger i dag.

(Junior) Specialist (m/k/d) for Market Research sidder i vores Data Analytics & Insights Team i vores Consumer Panel afdeling og er ansvarlig for analysedesign, projektforslag samt ad hoc dataanalyse og rapportering for vores nordiske kunder. (Junior) Specialist er i stand til at tage en stor mængde data, strukturere den efter det hver case og opbygge en relevant storyline for kunden i samarbejde med de ansvarlige konsulenter for hver kunde. Ved at rapportere til vores Director Data Analytics & Insights Team baseret i Tyskland vil projektlederen have en selvstændig tilgang til deres arbejde, men også drage fordel af et tæt samarbejde med konsulent-, kommercielle og operationelle kolleger på tværs af Norden.

Rollens formål

Formålet med rollen kan variere afhængigt af kandidatens faglige baggrund, men ideelt set omfatte:

Research Design


Definere passende analysedesign
Strukturere data og opbygge en relevant storyline
Ansvarlig for at levere alle typer indsigtsleverancer til kunder
Konstant forbedring af vores data og proceskvalitet
Give input til design af statistiske analyser og opsætning af effektive processer
Hvis relevant: er ansvarlig for projektledelsesopgaver
Proaktiv og selvstændig problemløsning (finder løsninger på forretningsproblemer), ikke kun udførelse af opgaver!


Analyse og rapportering


Udarbejde dybdegående kundeundersøgelser til rapporteringsformål eller detaljerede kundeønsker
Analysere data og trends i data ved hjælp af forskellige værktøjer med henblik på at generere indsigt til kunden
Udvikle præsentationsdiagrammer og klientrapporter med tilsvarende indsigt, som besvarer kundens spørgsmål; udnyttelse af faktabaseret rådgivning
Fremme automatiseringsprocesser og udvikle effektive måder til at skabe kundeleverancer såsom excel-tabeller, PPT-dias og interne programmer, du vil lære at bruge


Kundestyring


Til en vis grad have klientinteraktion og fungere som ekspert i den analyse, vi laver for dem
At stå for levering af månedlige/kvartalsvise/årlige rapporter til kunder


Krav


At læse og forstå enten dansk eller svensk
Engelsk sprogkundskaber - B2 min.
En fordel med kompetencer i Excel og PPT
Motivationen til at tage en stor mængde data, strukturere den og lave et univers til mange forskellige kunder
Klar på at lære vores interne dataanalyseprogrammer
Ideelt set i stand til at arbejde på vores kontor i København. Ellers arbejde fra vores Stockholm-kontor som et alternativ


Vi er en etisk og ærlig virksomhed, der er engageret i sine kunder og medarbejdere. Vi er stolte af at være en inkluderende arbejdsplads for alle og er forpligtet til lige muligheder i beskæftigelsen, som fokuserer på, at alle vores medarbejdere når deres fulde potentiale. Hos CPS arbejder vi sammen med vores kolleger, men tilbyder en fleksibel arbejdstilgang, herunder at dele vores tid mellem kontor & fjernarbejde samt mulighed for at flekse vores arbejdstid omkring teamets kernetimer.

Vi tilbyder et spændende arbejdsmiljø, der bringer mennesker sammen. Vi tilskynder til en iværksætterånd og innovativ ånd. Vi gør brug af de nyeste digitale teknologier. Vi søger en god kollega, som tager imod udfordringer og skaber løsninger.

Title: Business Intelligence (BI) Tester
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are You Ready to Work With the Latest Technologies?

We are looking to grow our IT team with a skilled and experienced Business Intelligence (BI) Tester. If you appreciate working with the latest technologies, wish to improve your career, and participate in continuous learning and training initiatives, it could be you who we are looking for.

Who Are We?

The RiskPoint Group is a global Managing General Underwriter (MGU) providing best-in-class insurance solutions backed by the insurance companies we act on behalf of.

You will become part of our new, small team of highly skilled BI professionals, who together holds many years of experience in insurance data. Our BI team is part of our growing IT team, which is part of our Finance & Operations department. In this role, you will be working with other IT colleagues in both Denmark and the UK as well as colleagues from other departments.

We operate in an agile organization with close cross-border cooperation across all business lines. And our organizational structure is flat, leaving many opportunities for all employees to make a difference, take responsibility, excel, and grow.

About The Position

As our new BI Tester, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality and reliability of our data pipelines, reports, and dashboards.

This is an onsite role based either in our Copenhagen office or in our London office, with the option to work remotely if approved by your manager. Occasional domestic and international travel may be required.

You will report to our CTO, who is located in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Your key responsibilities will include but not be limited to:


Design, develop, and maintain comprehensive test plans and test cases for BI solutions
Perform regression testing to ensure existing functionalities are not affected by new developments
Conduct behavioral testing to validate the system’s behavior against expected outcomes

If you are passionate about working for a noble cause on projects shaping the future of sustainable and intelligent pharma facilities, NNE is the place to be.

About The Role

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team of in our department for Financial Systems. As a team, we are developing and maintaining applications within the Finance Domain. Furthermore, you will be a part of the cross organizational ERP project.

As our new Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in developing business critical data solutions for NNE, as you will participate in building our cloud-based data reporting solution while also ensuring a smooth transition from our current reporting environment.

Location Virum Department Financial Systems

Experience 2 years Employment Type Full Time

How You Might Spend Your Days

As Data Analyst, you’ll:


Participate in project activities building a cloud-based Business Intelligence (BI) solution that integrates with Dynamics 365 ERP system
Develop new reports in the cloud, together with a dedicated and strong team of data analysts
In general build, change, and deploy reports in Power BI or Excel based on user Interpret and reconcile data from multiple sources
Handle ad hoc data requests from end users
Provide backend support for other applications within the Finance domain, e.g., Planning and Consolidation application as well as other systems



Who You Are

We care about who you are as a person. In the end, how you work, and your energy, is what impacts the results we achieve as a team. As a person, you have:


Excellent problem-solving and collaboration skills
A curious mindset and are a great team player
A strong understanding of business processes and the ability to translate user requirements into technical specifications
Agility and the ability to prioritize urgent tasks
Excitement to build on the NNE culture of innovation



The miles you’ve walked

In all positions there are some things that are needed, and others a bonus. We believe these qualifications are needed for you to do well in this role:


Prior experience working as a Data Analyst with advanced skills in data analysis, pivot tables, and complex formulas
Strong knowledge of SQL, Power BI and ETL development with ability to write and optimize queries for data extraction and manipulation
Familiarity with Azure Synapse Analytics and knowledge of Microsoft Fabric are an advantage
Bachelor’s degree in business, Computer science, Engineering, or related fields



If you do not check all the boxes, you are welcome to offer alternative experience that you think would be valuable in this role.

Why choose NNE?

We provide a range of perks and benefits tailored to enhance your overall experience. Some highlights include:


Vibrant and project-based work environment
Collaboration and innovation-based culture
True empowerment and flexible working conditions



Unleash your potential

NNE is short for Novo Nordisk Engineering. And for all of us who work here, NNE means so much more. We therefore greet new colleagues with our award-nominated onboarding program, and in-house talent programs designed to keep our biggest asset – you - developed for the long-run.

Did we spark your curiosity? If you’re ready to join our passion, let’s hear from you.

Questions before applying? Please contact Cecilia Maunsbach +45 3077 4535.

Title: BI & Data Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vil du arbejde i Danmarks førende mobilitetsvirksomhed med HB Care og Dantaxi som to stærke brands, og hvor datadrevne beslutninger er i fokus og skal være fundamentet for al forretning? Interesserer du dig for at sætte data og indsigter i spil med henblik på at optimere og understøtte en forretning, og vil du gøre det i tæt dialog med interessenter på tværs af forretning og i ledelse? Og har du lyst til at arbejde med front-end Power BI opgaver og back-end MS Azure opgaver, direkte og gennem eksterne leverandører? Så skal du læse videre.




Du bliver Moove Groups ’go-to-person’ inden for BI & Data og rapporterer direkte til chefen for IT & Digital. Når du ønsker dyb faglig sparring, så har du dygtige kollegaer i IT samt erfarne BI specialister eksternt hos forskellige leverandører, så du bliver derfor godt understøttet og har muligheden for faglig og teknisk udvikling.




Om jobbet

Moove Group har et stort potentiale for at bruge data som grundlag for beslutninger og styring af deres drift. Der er en transformation i gang mhp. at skifte centrale IT-systemer, hvilket åbner op for at optimere og tilpasse datastrukturer og governance, og her spiller du en vigtig rolle i relation til at definere fremtidens måde at arbejde med data.




Dit arbejde foregår i spændingsfeltet mellem data og forretning, og hvor du leverer ’end-to-end’ Power BI-løsninger. Udover selv at lave front-end løsninger, så er du også opgavestiller og kontakt til eksterne samarbejdspartnere, som bidrager til datadrevne beslutninger på tværs af Moove Group. Dine primære arbejdsopgaver inkluderer:




Opbygge, vedligeholde og optimere Power BI-rapporter for at understøtte datadrevne beslutninger i organisationen.
Samarbejde med interne og eksterne interessenter for at forstå deres behov, og hvordan de bedst kan opfyldes gennem diverse løsninger.
Bidrage til data governance og kvalitetssikring af valide data.
Drive forankring og brug af rapporter i organisationen.
Yde support til og træne Power BI-brugere samt understøtte ledelsen i deres forretningsindsigt og beslutninger.




Om profilen

Vi leder efter dig, der både trives med at udvikle front-end løsninger i Power BI og kan arbejde med back-end løsninger i MS Azure og Moove Groups on-prem data warehouse – og som kan arbejde både selvstændigt og i samarbejde med eksterne leverandører.




Vi forestiller os, at du har en akademisk baggrund inden for IT eller tilsvarende. Det betyder knap så meget, om du er nyuddannet eller har 3-5 års erfaring – opgaverne kan skræddersyes til at passe til dit erfaringsniveau og ambitioner. Det vigtigste er, at du har indgående kendskab til Power BI og gerne har haft berøring med MS Azure.




Som person er du nysgerrig, initiativrig og handlingsorienteret. Du trives med en dynamisk hverdag, hvor opgaverne er forskellige, men hvor de alle bliver løst med højt engagement og kvalitet. Det fordrer derfor også, at du er proaktiv, selvmotiverende, selvstændig og er god til at prioritere og planlægge dine opgaver.




Hvorfor du skal vælge Moove Group

Moove Group er en engageret, uformel og tillidsbaseret arbejdsplads, som er præget af fokus på at skabe værdi for forretningen. Du bliver del af et godt team, der står for en bred vifte af opgaver indenfor udvikling, drift og support, hvor de hver dag tænker kreativt og løsningsorienteret i udviklingen af det fremtidige IT-landskab – og der er fokus på at have det sjovt sammen undervejs.




Mange af medarbejderne synes også, at det er ekstra motiverende, at der i disse år investeres i nye innovative systemer, som understøtter automatisering, digitalisering og optimering af forretningen og biler og bussers driftssystemer.




Arbejdsstedet bliver i nye lokaler tæt ved Bagsværd station, hvor der altid er friskbrygget kaffe, en lækker frokostordning og et godt socialt miljø, der byder på alt fra fredagsbar til kunstklub. Og vigtigst af alt… en masse sjove, søde og dygtige kollegaer.

For mere information er du velkommen til at kontakte Jakob Schmidt-Hansen fra Hudson Nordic på mail js@hudsonnordic.com eller på telefon 31 21 07 12.

Title: Web Analytics Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Ønsker du at spille en nøglerolle i Telenor’s udvikling som digital forretning og være med til at påvirke data strategien i en spændende og kompleks abonnementsforretning? Som vores nye Web Analytics Specialist bliver du en integreret del af et højt kvalificeret team og får bl.a. ansvaret for at omsætte data til konkrete og værdiskabende initiativer – alt sammen med henblik på at sikre vores kunder får en sublim digital kundeoplevelse. Interesseret?

”Som Web Analytics Specialist er du med til at sikre, at vi hos Telenor løfter os fra datafundament til aktivering af data. Du bliver en central del af vores dygtige og dedikerede ecommerce-team, der dagligt arbejder for at sikre Telenor’s position på markedet, som teleselskabet der sætter kunden først” – Thomas Hermann, Head of Ecommerce

Du sikrer en sublim digital kundeoplevelse for Danmarks gladeste kunder

Som Web Analytics Specialist er du organisatorisk placeret i vores Market & Customers division. Her bliver du en del af vores ecommerce-team, hvis fornemmeste opgave er at sikre, at vi til enhver tid har nogle velsmurte webshops og skarpe selvbetjeningsmiljøer, som både skaber en sublim kundeoplevelse og en høj konverteringsrate.

I denne rolle får du mulighed for at udfolde dine analytiske evner til fulde idet du får mulighed for at fordybe dig i data og ecommerce. Du vil arbejde med komplekse datasæt, som du visualiserer og omsætter til indsigter, der leder til konkrete værdiskabende initiativer samtidig med, at du styrker dit kommercielle mindset.

Vi er på en rejse fra at have skabt et godt datagrundlag, til at bruge det bedre til rapportering, indsigter og aktivering på vores digitale platforme og her vil du spille en meget central rolle. I Telenor arbejder vi agilt i både specialiserede teams og tværfaglige value streams. I denne rolle, vil du primært blive en del af vores ecommerce team, men fra tid til anden vil du også indgå i vores tværfaglige value streams som enabler, når dine kompetencer efterspørges.

I denne rolle vil dine primære arbejdsopgaver være centreret omkring at:


Udforske og forstå vores data med en nysgerrig tilgang, og omsætte indsigterne til konkrete, værdiskabende initiativer, såsom konverteringsoptimerende tiltag, herunder automation og personalisering;
Deltage i overvejelser omkring marketing stack, identity resolution (f.eks. user id), first party data, integration, samtykkehåndtering og privatliv m.v.;
Beslutte, dokumentere, implementere, teste og validere tracking på tværs af web og apps, samt sikre en ensartet, skalerbar opsætning på tværs af brands;
Implementere og opdatere marketing tracking (Facebook Pixel, Google Ads etc.), samt UX- og CRO-værktøjer; og
Opsætte, optimere og vedligeholde interaktive dashboards til monitorering af KPI’er via Looker Studio og Power BI.


Du har blik for det digitale og kommercielle i en teknisk verden

I denne rolle får du mulighed for at udnytte din erfaring inden for dataanalyse og performance tracking til at gøre en reel forskel. Du arbejder individuelt, men får samtidig mulighed for at samarbejde tæt med relevante interessenter og blive en værdsat sparringspartner takket være din evne til at kommunikere klart og dit smittende gode humør.

Din høje faglighed giver dig mulighed for at sætte retning, tage ansvar og træffe vigtige beslutninger, mens du sikrer, at dine opgaver bliver eksekveret og afsluttet til tiden. Med din strukturerede tilgang vil du kunne løse opgaver effektivt og skabe værdi for teamet såvel som resten af organisationen.

Derudover forestiller vi os, at du:


Er initiativrig og tager styring for at maksimere værdien af data;
Har erfaring med web analytics og tracking, især i GA4;
Er dygtig til implementering, f.eks. via Google Tag Manager (dette foregår i tæt samarbejde med udviklere);
Har solide færdigheder inden for Power BI, Looker Studio, og datavisualisering; og
Har erfaring med ecommerce eller har kendskab til områder som CDP, Adobe Analytics, SQL osv.


Sidstnævnte er en fordel, men ikke et krav. Vi håber mest af alt, at du har et kæmpe drive for at lykkes med det, du sætter dig for og deler vores ønske om at skabe sublime digitale kundeoplevelser.

En arbejdsplads fyldt med Fantastiske forbindelser

Du bliver en del af en foranderlig organisation, hvor der, på tværs af forretningen, venter dedikerede og dygtige kolleger, som kontinuerligt arbejder for at udvikle fremtidens teleselskab. Vi arbejder agilt, fokuserer indsatsområder ved hjælp af Kanban og praktiserer Tight-Loose-Tight som ledelsesfilosofi. Med de nyeste løsninger og det mest effektive netværk skaber vi små mirakler i en verden, der aldrig står stille.

Du kan læse mere om os her .

I foråret foretog vi en sammenlægning af Telenor og CBB. Ved at bygge på det bedste fra vores to verdener og samle vores kompetencer, mener vi, at vi kan blive skarpere på måden at arbejde med produkter, kundeoplevelse og udvikling på. Således vil du i denne rolle arbejde med begge brands i én stærk fælles organisation, som har et fælles fokus på kundeoplevelser, produktudvikling og marked.

Interesseret?

Har du spørgsmål eller vil du vide mere om stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Head of Ecommerce, Thomas Hermann, via kontaktoplysningerne til højre.

Kan du se dig selv i rollen og har du interesse i at blive en Fantastisk forbindelse søger du blot stillingen via linket øverst her på siden. Du behøver ikke skrive en ansøgning, men vi ser meget gerne et CV fra dig. Derudover har du mulighed for at sætte et par ord på dig selv gennem vores ansøgningsskema. 

Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig senest d. 29. september, men gerne før, da vi holder samtaler løbende.

Title: Performance Intelligence Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have a knack for uncovering game-changing insights from complex data? Can you transform numbers into compelling stories that drive customer behavior for global brands? If so, seize this opportunity to make a significant impact as a Performance Intelligence Consultant at VML MAP!

What will your day look like?

As Performance Intelligence Consultant, you'll be at the forefront of data-driven decision-making and play a vital role in understanding client priorities and objectives. With a foundational understanding of user experience and a strong grasp of data and analytical approaches, you'll be the bridge between data and strategy. Your daily activities will include conducting detailed data analysis to identify performance trends, designing and executing A/B tests and analyzing the results to provide optimization recommendations. You'll also be preparing and presenting performance reports, and your strong communication skills and storytelling abilities will ensure that actionable insights are delivered in an easily understood format, and in a way that motivates and provides a clear direction for various teams.

More Specifically, Your Tasks Include


Conduct detailed data analysis to identify performance trends and insights.
Prepare and present performance reports and translate the insights to internal teams as well as our clients, with a focus on content, audience, and channels.
Maintain and update performance dashboards and analytics tools.
Collaborate with various teams to ensure data-driven decision-making.
Design, execute and analyze A/B tests to identify the most effective strategies and tactics.
Approach all task with curiosity and open-mindedness, constantly striving to uncover further insights from the available data.


Who are you going to work with?

You'll join our growing Insights and Intelligence team, reporting to the Performance Intelligence Lead. You'll work closely with various teams, especially data and analytics specialists , and be the bridge between client and technical teams.

What do you bring to the table?

We're looking for curious minds with a strategic outlook and a passion for data. You're not just comfortable with numbers; you're adept at translating them into narratives that resonate with both technical and non-technical audiences, and you have a strong curiosity to discover the 'why' behind the data. Additionally, you are very collaboratively oriented, and you love working with cross-functional teams. Your expertise in detailed analysis and optimization will be instrumental in driving improvements and delivering actionable insights that enhance our daily tasks for clients.

In Addition, You Have


A strong understanding of marketing performance metrics such as open-rates, click through rates and journey data and experience analyzing campaign performance across digital channels.
Experience with data visualizations tools such as Power BI and Tableau. Knowledge of SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions and data manipulation.
Ability to translate complex data into understandable insights for non-technical audiences.
Skills in crafting compelling narratives from data insights.
Experience in presenting findings and recommendations to clients and/or Senior stakeholders.
Skills in managing expectations and building trust with clients and internal teams.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment with an open mind.
Understanding of A/B testing methodologies and tools.


A leader in personalized customer experiences

VML MAP is a world-leading Centre of Excellence that helps businesses humanize the relationship between the brand and the customer through hyper personalization at scale, marketing automation and CRM. With the brain of a consultancy, the heart of an agency and the power of technology and data, we work with some of the world's most admired brands to help them on their transformation journey to becoming truly customer-centric. Together, we are 1000 + technology specialists, data scientists, strategic thinkers, consultants, operations experts, and creative minds from 55+ nationalities.

A global network

We are part of the global VML network that encompasses more than 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 60+ markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

At VML, we are committed to fostering an all-inclusive work environment that is both rewarding and career-forward. Our Inclusion, Equity & Belonging initiatives, alongside the VML Foundation, reflect our dedication to giving back and making a positive impact in our communities and beyond. Our people are the heartbeat of our organization-creators, doers, innovators, makers, and thinkers-who drive not just marketing, but meaningful experiences that resonate in every action and interaction.

For more information, please visit our website , and follow us on our social channels via Instagram and LinkedIn .

When you click "Submit Application" your information is sent to VML MAP. To learn more about how we process your personal data when you apply for a role with us, how you can update your information, or have your information removed, please read our Privacy Policy . California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice .

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Engineer looking to have a significant impact on the transformation of the data landscape of a company with more than 20,000 employees worldwide? Then join BESTSELLER – an international fashion company with brands like ONLY, JACK & JONES and VERO MODA.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Data & Analytics department in BESTSELLER, working out of either our office in Amsterdam (NL), Aarhus (DK) or Brande (DK). As a department, we are responsible for delivering quality data products and developing the corporate data strategy for BESTSELLER – and our field is at the top of our business agenda.

YOUR TEAM & ROLE

With a system landscape typical of a 50-year-old company, BESTSELLER is undergoing a transformation into a modern data mesh architecture. This shift will significantly enhance how our business trusts data and makes data-driven decisions.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to dive into the world of large datasets and tackle complex challenges? Then join our Data Engineering team for the chance to contribute to the development of a modern data warehouse, empowering data-driven decision-making, and make a real impact on our global supply chain.

We’re looking for an experienced colleague to join our Logistics Data & Reporting team.

YOUR TEAM & ROLE

As a part of the Logistics Data & Reporting team, you will get experienced colleagues that work with passion and commitment to drive innovation and lead the data path forward. We have the necessary priority and trust from the business that we support to execute on our ambitious goals. We must deliver one truth and data transparency, which requires us to test new technologies and ideas. All while balancing accuracy and continuous improvement, supporting BESTSELLER’s continued global success.

As Data Engineer, your job is to extract and transform data that enables BESTSELLER Logistics to make proactive decisions. More specifically your tasks include:


Creating data transparency
Tackling large dataset challenges
Extracting data from a variety of data sources
Supporting the transition from Excel-extracts to proper data sources
Implementing monitoring mechanisms to improve data quality
Automating as much as possible
Supporting our reporting and performance landscape with data.


Your Benefits

Joining BESTSELLER Logistics and the Data & Reporting team gives you the opportunities to accelerate your career in an environment where the ambitions are high, and the opportunities are great. You will be backed by your manager, who has a background as a developer, and you will experience responsibility from day one and can set your mark on our supply chain.

We offer a great deal of flexibility in your work, but most importantly you will join a team with highly skilled colleagues who help each other. Your personal and professional development means a lot to us, which is why active learning is a part of our tasks.

YOUR PROFILE

We are looking for an experienced, business-minded candidate with a drive towards show results. You are able to work independently, setting and executing on the ambitions for your focus area. You have an eye for identifying business potential and know how to communicate your knowledge to stakeholders at various levels. You are able to navigate in a fast-paced environment, where it’s paramount that we pull together and everyone contributes with great spirit and positive energy.

Your heart lies within writing SQL that performs and is easy to maintain, so we are looking for the following specific qualifications to the team:


Some years of experience with SQL
Knowledge about SQL performance and optimizations
Experience with designing and implementing Data Warehouse models
Experience with Azure (Fabric or ADF)
Experience with GIT
Strong English skills, both written and spoken.


WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

If you have any questions about the position, please do not hesitate to contact Mikael Winther Bertelsen on +45 30 85 37 15. Otherwise, please send us your CV and application as soon as possible and no later than 23 October 2024. We review applications on an ongoing basis and are aiming to fill the position as soon as possible.

LOCATION: Your primary work location will be either our office in Aarhus or our distribution center in Haderslev, but you can expect to work from both offices during the week.

Title: Student Analyst - Digital Trading Products
Description:
Looking to grow your skills in AI and data analytics? As a Student Analyst you’ll work with commercial and technical teams to optimize digital trading, and help drive Abacus Medicine forward on its exciting growth journey.




Drive meaningful change

Join our team as a Student Analyst to help enhance our digital trading models and infrastructure. In this role, you’ll primarily work on analyzing and improving trading systems, utilizing data analytics to drive performance and optimize operations. You’ll collaborate with both commercial and technical teams to ensure that our trading models align with business goals. While exploring AI and machine learning applications is a part of the role, the core focus will be on maintaining and developing trading models that improve overall efficiency and support strategic initiatives.




Your main responsibilities will be:




Enhance and maintain digital trading products and models to align with business goals, focusing on trading systems and optimization, with some involvement in AI/ML integrations.
Gather, analyze, and report performance metrics to support data-driven decision-making and improve trading models through analytics.
Collaborate with commercial and technical teams on various projects, assisting in the development of trading solutions and translating business insights into actionable tasks.
Assist in preparing reports and presentations for stakeholder meetings, supporting effective communication and gathering valuable feedback.
Provide research and analytical support to identify opportunities for operational improvements, with a focus on enhancing the performance of trading models and systems.




Your Profile

We are looking for a Student Analyst, currently pursuing a degree in Finance, Economics, Data Science, or related disciplines (e.g., cand.merc., cand.polit., or similar), with strong analytical skills, attention to detail, effective communication, and a proactive attitude, eager to collaborate on innovative projects. In addition, we highly value if you have interest in learning about AI and machine learning applications in trading or financial systems.




Furthermore, we imagine you have:




Prior experience in an analytical or research role is a plus (e.g., internships, academic projects).
Basic understanding of data analysis, financial systems, or trading models is desirable.
Basic understanding of data processing and reporting.
Proficiency in data analysis tools, including MS Excel and PowerPoint; experience with SQL, Python, or Power BI is an advantage but not required.
Fluent in English, both written and verbal.




Be part of an international community of people who care

Join a dynamic, supportive team that fosters collaboration, innovation, and open communication. As a new department, we offer the unique chance to help build from the ground up. You'll gain strong learning opportunities, working with experts to develop skills in data analytics, trading models, and technologies like AI and machine learning.




At Abacus, we truly care about each other. 'Friendly' is the word most often used by employees to describe us. Our sense of belonging extends beyond work, with local clubs and global initiatives that connect us. You'll experience a positive, caring workplace with a strong sense of community.




Would you like to know more about us?

If you have any further questions about the role, please do not hesitate to contact the hiring manager, Rasmus Fosgaard Olsen, Manager - Digital Trading Products, rasmus.olsen@abacusmedicine.com.

Title: Data Engineer in Intraday power team
Description:
Join the team as MFT Energy's new Data Engineer in Intraday power team

In MFT Energy, we trade energy to make markets efficient and to facilitate the green transition. We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our ambitious Intraday power team with experienced colleagues, who strive to be the best every day.




The job as Data Engineer

You will be a part of our great Intraday power team working with highly ambitious and qualified quantitative analysts, machine-learning experts, tool and system developers, and traders, which means you’ll be as close to the action as you can be.




We prioritize getting an MVP in production to get immediate feedback meaning that a good solution is a trade-off between speed of implementation and extendability to continuously improve our solutions.




As a Data Engineer, you will develop and maintain a sophisticated data architecture used by your colleagues in the front-office team. You will be responsible for creating data pipelines, managing our different data sources, and ensuring high-quality data flow across various projects. All this work will be done in close cooperation with both a central data team and with technically competent quants in this team. This role gives you the chance to dive deep into the exciting power domain, and your work will be critical in unifying our data agenda and supporting both in-house and third-party data needs.




It will be a requirement to be proactive and be able to work autonomously as your collaborators will know "the what" but expect you to figure out "the how". In doing so, you will have the mandate to shape the solution using our existing setup or possibly introducing new tech. Expect that the results you deliver will be used within the day and that your impact will be recognized.




Your key responsibilities

Design and implement data pipelines for efficient data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL).
Manage the central databases, ensuring data is validated, cleaned, and monitored.
Collaborate with quantitative analysts, platform engineers, and traders to meet their data needs.
Help enforce best practices for data management, including schema design and data governance.
Optimize data storage solutions to balance performance, cost, and scalability – this will be done with data engineers from our central team as well.




Your core skills

Proficiency in Python.
Experience with database management.
Strong understanding of data modeling and ETL processes.
Familiarity with orchestration and data pipeline tools such as Prefect, Apache Airflow, or similar.
Experience with Azure services such as Azure Functions and Azure Data Explorer or similar cloud services.
Strong analytical skills and an eye for detail.




Beneficial skills

Experience with SQL and KQL.
Familiarity with containerization tools (e.g., Docker).
Experience with or interest in big data technologies (Spark, Databricks).




Your qualifications

Relevant experience in data engineering or a related field.
MSc or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Engineering, Business intelligence, Economy, or a related discipline.




Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We are 163 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Turkey, Australia, Austin, Singapore, and several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best and our work culture is based on collaboration, transparency, and a proactive mindset.




We offer:

A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment.
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions.
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach.
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.




Make the Most of Your Talent! Join us!

If you think there is a match between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with a short cover letter and CV. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.




Start date: As soon as possible.




We will be screening and interviewing candidates on an ongoing basis.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer til hurtigtvoksende scale-up virksomhed

 

Data er blevet et nøgleord hos Frameo, og derfor søger vi nu en Data Engineer med erfaring indenfor datahåndtering og -analyse, som kan hjælpe os til at styrke vores datastruktur og give værdifuld indsigt gennem vores store mængder data.




Hos Frameo udvikler vi software til Wi-Fi billedrammer, der med mere end 12 mio. app downloads er verdens førende. Du bliver en del af tech afdelingen, som består af en flok dedikerede og dygtige medarbejdere, hvor høj faglighed og godt kollegaskab er i højsædet.




Dine arbejdsopgaver:

Som Data Engineer hos os vil du spille en central rolle ift. at etablere og vedligeholde data-pipelines, sikre høj kvalitet af data og datastrukturer samt analysere og præsentere vores omfattende datamængder. Du vil arbejde med datasæt på flere terabytes, hvor der dagligt tilføjes hundredvis af gigabytes data. Du vil komme til at arbejde tæt sammen med både product management, tech, salg og ledelse for at skabe værdi af de store mængder data og understøtte beslutningsprocesser og forretningsudvikling i Frameo. 




Dine primære ansvarsområder vil omfatte:

Håndtering og strukturering af virksomhedens data i BigQuery
Udvikling og optimering af SQL-forespørgsler
Anvendelse af statistiske metoder til dataanalyse
Assistere med dataindsamling og identificering af datapunkter
Design og implementering af dashboards
Sikring af datakvalitet og -integritet
Udvikling og vedligehold af data pipelines (ETL jobs)




Om dig:

Du har 3-5 års erfaring i tilsvarende stilling, og vi ser gerne, at du også har en videregående uddannelse, hvor omdrejningspunktet har været dataanalyse, programmering eller tilsvarende. Derudover forventer vi, at du har: 

Solid erfaring med SQL
Erfaring med at arbejde med store datasæt (TB-skala)
Erfaring med statistiske analysemetoder
Erfaring med Cloud baserede data warehouse løsninger - i dag bruger vi BigQuery
Erfaring med visualiseringsværktøjer, eksempelvis Looker Studio
Stærke analytiske evner og sans for detaljer
Evne til at kommunikere komplekse data koncepter til ikke-tekniske interessenter







Hvad kan vi tilbyde dig?

Du vil blive en del af en spændende, ung scale-up virksomhed i vækst, hvor der er tæt samarbejde og kontakt på kryds og tværs af afdelinger i et uformelt kontormiljø. Der vil være høj grad af selvstændighed og frihed i stillingen med mulighed for at præge din egen dagligdag og udvikle dig både personligt og fagligt. 




Derudover tilbyder vi:  

Pensionsordning og sundhedsforsikring
Betalt telefoni, internet, mobiltelefon og arbejdscomputer

Title: Senior Statistician / Data Scientist
Place: Gladsaxe, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to use your statistical background to develop drugs and improve the lives for patients over the world? Do you want to help scientists in Novo Nordisk use their experimental resources and data in the best possible way? Are you passionate about extracting actionable insights from data and have a keen interest in digital transformation? If so, we offer an exciting position as Data Scientist/Statistician, so apply today!

 

The position
As a Senior Data Scientist/Statistician in CMC Development, you support the development of products, manufacturing processes and analytical methods together with four competent colleagues. You cooperate with colleagues from other areas of expertise across the organisation to solve their problems using advanced statistical methods. Good solutions balance business needs and quality requirements, and close collaboration with stakeholders is needed to ensure this. You will have the opportunity to leverage your exceptional communication skills and proactively engage with stakeholders within our organization to introduce and implement new ideas.

 

You can look forward to a broad variety of responsibilities, such as:

 



Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop, deliver, and present statistical solutions in a clear language and ensure that they are used as intended.
Engage with internal stakeholders to identify opportunities for innovation and drive the adoption of new ideas within the organization.
Utilize your expertise in data science to drive digital transformation and automate across CMC Development.




 

The statistical tools are often linear mixed models, design of experiments, general explorative statistics, multivariate statistics, and statistical process control.

It is important that you are curious by nature in terms of new technologies and have an interest in areas like e.g., Machine learning, digital transformation etc.

 

Qualifications

You have a strong background in mathematical statistics as Master's of Science or Ph.D. in statistics or engineering. Preferably you have at least 5 years of experience from a similar position in the pharmaceutical industry with a proven track record.

 

It will be considered an advantage if you have:



Experience with implementation of Machine learning models in controlled manufacturing environment.
Experience with SAS for Windows and SAS JMP
Experience with R and (or) Python.
Experience of working in consultancy role




 

As a person, you are curious and interested in other scientific disciplines. You attend to details and are systematic in your work, while also focusing on how to simplify complex matters to communicate clearly with other scientists, management, or regulatory authorities. You work independently and with high engagement.

 

About The Department

You are part of the function CMC Digitalisation, Data & Outsourcing that delivers specialised support to CMC Development & Scaling. We are five Data Scientists/statisticians in the department. We value creativity, innovation, and the ability to work with people of different backgrounds and focus on standardising and optimising work processes. You have ample opportunity to develop your professional and personal skills as well as influencing your job.

 

CMC Outsourcing and Data Science is a department of approx. 31 highly competent colleagues with the shared goal to support the Novo Nordisk drug development pipeline. The Data Science team in the department supports the Novo Nordisk drug development pipeline through statistical support and process optimisation.

 

Working at Novo Nordisk
At Novo Nordisk, we create value by putting patients first. Every ten seconds two people are diagnosed with diabetes, and close to 366 million people worldwide need us. Working here is not just a way to make a living, but a way to make a difference.

 

Contact
For further information, please contact Statistical Specialist Ken Sejling at +45 3079 9188 or Head of Data Science Abdul Rauf Khan at rakx@novonordisk.com.

 

Deadline
28 September 2024

 

Please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst – Student assistant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We're a dynamic and innovative scale-up that is transforming the IoT landscape. At Factbird, we're revolutionizing data collection and production monitoring, and we are dedicated to craft engaging products that boost efficiency and profitability by streamlining production processes.

Join a team that is passionate about providing exceptional experiences, collaboration, and mutual respect. We embrace bold ideas and inject fun into our work while driving impactful innovations. The potential for growth and learning knows no bounds here.

Here's what you'll be up to:

As a Student Assistant in our Business Intelligence/Revenue Operations Team, you'll be a key part of our team, working with different technologies like Power BI, SQL, and Python to provide commercial and financial insights and support to our commercial side of the business. You will report to our Revenue Operations Manager and primarily work alongside our Business Intelligence Analyst. We work with all departments within the company, and as such there is a wide range of opportunities to form connections with other departments.

Key responsibilities will include:


Assist team leadership with reporting, analysis and data management tasks including (but not limited to) sales and marketing performance, financial KPIs, etc.
Data cleaning, transformation and ingestion into our Data Warehouse.
Update Power BI to visualize performance and assist sales and marketing management to make better decisions based on data.
Developing tools and templates for reporting, analysis, and forecasts.
Supporting the organization with ad hoc data analysis and reports on business-related questions.


And here's the best part – at Factbird, merit matters more than seniority. Your opinions will be valued, and your contributions will be celebrated. We believe in fostering an inclusive, flexible, and growth-oriented environment right here in vibrant Copenhagen.

Here's what we'd love to see in you:

You will be supporting us part time, ideally between 15 and 20 hours per week, while you continue with your education. As the ideal candidate


You are currently in the last year of your bachelor’s degree or in your first year of your master’s degree within the fields of Business analytics, Economics , Computer science or similar.
Experience with Power BI and SQL/ GoogleSQL
You possess excellent skills within Microsoft office, particularly Excel and PowerPoint.
You have great verbal and written English communication as you will be working with international colleagues.
You can take responsibility for your work areas and work independently but also as a part of a team.
You have an eye for detail and strive to complete your tasks in a timely and precise manner.


A Little About Us

Factbird is a game-changing end-to-end manufacturing intelligence solution that simplifies data gathering and analysis for all manufacturers. With this solution at your fingertips, you can finally take charge of your manufacturing efficiency and redefine the boundaries of success. Factbird, in business since 2015, is now used in over 25 countries worldwide and trusted by 300+ manufacturers daily, with offices in Denmark and the US.

Our story is a narrative of ceaseless innovation, collaborative growth, and a resolute commitment to our customers. We've continually evolved, developing our product with our clients' feedback, establishing features and solutions that not only restructure industry operations but cement our position as a trailblazer in manufacturing technology.

We're scaling significantly across the globe after a recent funding round, and we want you to be a part of our exciting journey! Join the Factbird Team, and you'll enjoy


Flexible working hours with hybrid work options, especially around exam periods.
Skills development and growth opportunities.
A central office location in the heart of Copenhagen, next to Vesterport station.
A competitive salary to recognize your valuable contributions.
A warm and structured onboarding.
An international, diverse, and inclusive culture with colleagues from 17 different nationalities!


Ready to embark on an incredible journey and shape the future of data collection and production monitoring?

Don't miss this exciting opportunity – join us now by submitting your application! Plus, feel free to share this awesome chance with anyone who'd be a perfect fit!

Our interview process is a breeze – it starts with a chat with our recruiter, followed by one technical interview, and culminates with a talk with our leadership team. Got any questions or need more details? Reach out to Khristel Marie Aparicio at khma@factbird.com.
