Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us in building the data platforms of the future and shaping how Accenture will become the best in Denmark in AI!

We are currently a group of 20 members in Accenture's department and specialist group for data and artificial intelligence, and we need more wise and committed minds to join our team! As part of Accenture's Data & AI community, you will help build data solutions as well as our internal professional environment within the field.

In our projects, you use a range of skills. We work with data engineering, frontend and backend development, DevOps, data architecture, machine learning and Generative AI. You yourself will have an influence on everyday working life based on what you want to work with. At Accenture, you are in the driver's seat for your future technology career, regardless of whether you want to become a technical expert or a manager with a broad technology background. Accenture is a career school where we guide and learn from each other.

Who are we looking for?

To give you a clearer impression of who we are, we present two of our employees' everyday working life below. We are looking for more AI enthusiasts like Chris and Aurora, with similar ambitions and courage to become part of our active and forward-looking professional environment. In this professional environment, we work with the latest technology in AI and Cloud, organize workshops internally and in customer projects, support technology sales and develop high-quality solutions for our customers.

You are solution-oriented, curious and like to familiarize yourself with new issues where you share your knowledge. You must be happy to work in a team, while also being able to work independently with demanding tasks for our customers.

We are looking for you who:



Has 3+ years of relevant work experience


Has a burning interest in data engineering and artificial intelligence


Has experience with system development, frontend or backend


Has experience with Azure, Google Cloud Platform or AWS


Has practical experience with AI/ML and relevant technologies


Preferably speaks Danish



What can we offer you?



Opportunity to work with frontier technologies on exciting projects with leading companies across various industries


Professional development and training opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career


A local as well as global network


A competitive salary and benefits



Chris's everyday life at Accenture

I studied physics and mathematics and delved into quantum machine learning during my master's. Since I finished my studies in 2022, I have worked at Accenture as a data engineer in the Data&AI department. In my role as backend developer on a significant data platform project for one of our larger clients, I have mainly focused on backend development. I have also had the pleasure of exploring other areas such as front-end development and work with software release strategies, as well as CI/CD automation. This has given me a wide range of skills and experiences in various aspects of software development.

I am actively involved in our vibrant Data&AI community. We regularly organize presentations and invite external speakers to keep us up to date on the latest trends and innovations in the field. In addition, I take regular artificial intelligences and data-related courses to keep up to date with the ever-developing professional landscape. For me, the social aspect is just as important as the academic aspect. Fortunately, this is a group where well-being and togetherness are the focus. We see each other as friends as well as colleagues, and together we organize everything from social events to professional gatherings.

Aurora’s everyday life at Accenture

I have worked as a data engineer in Data&AI since 2022, after studying Computer Science and Engineering at DTU. At university, I immersed myself in various machine learning subjects, and finally ended up with a master's on predicting ship activity in the (partly untouched) Arctic. The combination of data analysis and ML algorithms added flavor, and luckily I get the opportunity to continue exploring this field here at Accenture, with fantastically talented and good colleagues!

I have previously worked on the same project as Chris as data engineer for a large digital transformation, where we use a number of technologies and frameworks for end-to-end development. I am currently on a smaller project working on developing a Generative AI solution through OpenAI. It is incredibly exciting and meaningful to apply today's technology to well-established processes at well-known players. GenAI is a hot topic, which is shown through great commitment to the project within Accenture and at the customer.

In addition to project work, I help lead Accenture's female mentorship program for university students. So there is a lot of variety that you can get involved in, while at the same time you have your belonging in our exotic Data & AI community. Here we are friends and colleagues with the same interests, although there is great variation in the number of years of experience and types of projects, which creates a fantastic starting point to learn from each other. Good atmosphere, low shoulders and commitment!

Does this sound interesting?

Then we would like to hear from you! Paradoxically, we prefer application letters not written by ChatGPT.

GenAI is a hot topic, which is shown through great commitment to the project within Accenture and at the customer.

    In addition to project work, I help lead Accenture's female mentorship program for university students. So there is a lot of variety that you can get involved in, while at the same time you have your belonging in our exotic Data & AI community. Here we are friends and colleagues with the same interests, although there is great variation in the number of years of experience and types of projects, which creates a fantastic starting point to learn from each other. Good atmosphere, low shoulders and commitment!

    Does this sound interesting?

    Then we would like to hear from you! Paradoxically, we prefer application letters not written by ChatGPT.

We are looking for a colleague to join our newly established team: Credit Risk Model Data Flow. To join the team, you should have a few years of relevant experience with risk data and/or models, as we are looking for experienced candidates. We hope you will come with an eagerness to set up new processes and develop in a collaborative environment.

 

At Nordea, we’re committed to being a partner our customers and society can count on. Compliance and integrity go hand in hand. Joining us means you’ll have an impact on how we do banking – today and tomorrow. So bring your ideas, skills and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger.  

About this opportunity

 

Welcome to the Credit Risk Model Data Flow team, a part of Risk Models organisation. At Nordea, we use internal models for calculating regulatory capital and these models are developed and maintained by Risk Models. We work with a data asset that collect and aggregate data from most of Nordea’s data landscape. The Credit Risk Model Data Flow team has a range of upstream and downstream stakeholders and close collaboration with these stakeholders is crucial for capital reporting.  Embark on an exciting opportunity to join our team as the Quantitative Risk Analyst. In this role, you'll be at the forefront of driving data excellence and operational efficiency.

 

Your responsibilities will include:

Spearheading operational activities to elevate data quality and compliance levels, ensuring seamless processes
Supporting a smooth production flow of critical data, meeting and surpassing agreed Service Level Agreements (SLAs)
Adapting data based on evolving business needs to guarantee its relevance and suitability
Playing a pivotal role in establishing robust processes and shaping operational standards
Upholding top-notch governance practices, fostering an environment of high data quality
Collaborating closely with stakeholders, driving continual enhancements in our production processes.

 Join us in this dynamic role where you'll make a tangible impact on data integrity and operational excellence! You will work closely with other teams in Risk Models (both data and modelling teams), as well as with IT and Business related teams.



Who you are 

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  

 

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

Are a self-driven individual with an ambition to deliver timely and high quality analysis
Are outgoing, can communicate effectively, and can build good relationships with colleagues with diverse competences, nationalities and responsibilities
Have strong collaboration skills, are proactive in working across the organisation, as you will occasionally act as a bridge between Risk Models, business and IT to ensure correct understanding between all parties

 

Your experience and background: 

Hold a degree in finance, data, quantitative or technology related field, including but not limited to mathematics, economics, statistics, data science or similar
Have an analytical mindset and programming experience with SQL and PowerBI (Python, R – nice to have)
Have a good understanding of risk models and/or data
Excellent written and spoken English

Title: Web Analytics Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Ønsker du at spille en nøglerolle i Telenor’s udvikling som digital forretning og være med til at påvirke data strategien i en spændende og kompleks abonnementsforretning? Som vores nye Web Analytics Specialist bliver du en integreret del af et højt kvalificeret team og får bl.a. ansvaret for at omsætte data til konkrete og værdiskabende initiativer – alt sammen med henblik på at sikre vores kunder får en sublim digital kundeoplevelse. Interesseret?

”Som Web Analytics Specialist er du med til at sikre, at vi hos Telenor løfter os fra datafundament til aktivering af data. Du bliver en central del af vores dygtige og dedikerede ecommerce-team, der dagligt arbejder for at sikre Telenor’s position på markedet, som teleselskabet der sætter kunden først” – Thomas Hermann, Head of Ecommerce

Du sikrer en sublim digital kundeoplevelse for Danmarks gladeste kunder

Som Web Analytics Specialist er du organisatorisk placeret i vores Market & Customers division. Her bliver du en del af vores ecommerce-team, hvis fornemmeste opgave er at sikre, at vi til enhver tid har nogle velsmurte webshops og skarpe selvbetjeningsmiljøer, som både skaber en sublim kundeoplevelse og en høj konverteringsrate.

I denne rolle får du mulighed for at udfolde dine analytiske evner til fulde idet du får mulighed for at fordybe dig i data og ecommerce. Du vil arbejde med komplekse datasæt, som du visualiserer og omsætter til indsigter, der leder til konkrete værdiskabende initiativer samtidig med, at du styrker dit kommercielle mindset.

Vi er på en rejse fra at have skabt et godt datagrundlag, til at bruge det bedre til rapportering, indsigter og aktivering på vores digitale platforme og her vil du spille en meget central rolle. I Telenor arbejder vi agilt i både specialiserede teams og tværfaglige value streams. I denne rolle, vil du primært blive en del af vores ecommerce team, men fra tid til anden vil du også indgå i vores tværfaglige value streams som enabler, når dine kompetencer efterspørges.

I denne rolle vil dine primære arbejdsopgaver være centreret omkring at:


Udforske og forstå vores data med en nysgerrig tilgang, og omsætte indsigterne til konkrete, værdiskabende initiativer, såsom konverteringsoptimerende tiltag, herunder automation og personalisering;
Deltage i overvejelser omkring marketing stack, identity resolution (f.eks. user id), first party data, integration, samtykkehåndtering og privatliv m.v.;
Beslutte, dokumentere, implementere, teste og validere tracking på tværs af web og apps, samt sikre en ensartet, skalerbar opsætning på tværs af brands;
Implementere og opdatere marketing tracking (Facebook Pixel, Google Ads etc.), samt UX- og CRO-værktøjer; og
Opsætte, optimere og vedligeholde interaktive dashboards til monitorering af KPI’er via Looker Studio og Power BI.


Du har blik for det digitale og kommercielle i en teknisk verden

I denne rolle får du mulighed for at udnytte din erfaring inden for dataanalyse og performance tracking til at gøre en reel forskel. Du arbejder individuelt, men får samtidig mulighed for at samarbejde tæt med relevante interessenter og blive en værdsat sparringspartner takket være din evne til at kommunikere klart og dit smittende gode humør.

Din høje faglighed giver dig mulighed for at sætte retning, tage ansvar og træffe vigtige beslutninger, mens du sikrer, at dine opgaver bliver eksekveret og afsluttet til tiden. Med din strukturerede tilgang vil du kunne løse opgaver effektivt og skabe værdi for teamet såvel som resten af organisationen.

Derudover forestiller vi os, at du:


Er initiativrig og tager styring for at maksimere værdien af data;
Har erfaring med web analytics og tracking, især i GA4;
Er dygtig til implementering, f.eks. via Google Tag Manager (dette foregår i tæt samarbejde med udviklere);
Har solide færdigheder inden for Power BI, Looker Studio, og datavisualisering; og
Har erfaring med ecommerce eller har kendskab til områder som CDP, Adobe Analytics, SQL osv.


Sidstnævnte er en fordel, men ikke et krav. Vi håber mest af alt, at du har et kæmpe drive for at lykkes med det, du sætter dig for og deler vores ønske om at skabe sublime digitale kundeoplevelser.

En arbejdsplads fyldt med Fantastiske forbindelser

Du bliver en del af en foranderlig organisation, hvor der, på tværs af forretningen, venter dedikerede og dygtige kolleger, som kontinuerligt arbejder for at udvikle fremtidens teleselskab. Vi arbejder agilt, fokuserer indsatsområder ved hjælp af Kanban og praktiserer Tight-Loose-Tight som ledelsesfilosofi. Med de nyeste løsninger og det mest effektive netværk skaber vi små mirakler i en verden, der aldrig står stille.

Du kan læse mere om os her .

I foråret foretog vi en sammenlægning af Telenor og CBB. Ved at bygge på det bedste fra vores to verdener og samle vores kompetencer, mener vi, at vi kan blive skarpere på måden at arbejde med produkter, kundeoplevelse og udvikling på. Således vil du i denne rolle arbejde med begge brands i én stærk fælles organisation, som har et fælles fokus på kundeoplevelser, produktudvikling og marked.

Interesseret?

Har du spørgsmål eller vil du vide mere om stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Head of Ecommerce, Thomas Hermann, via kontaktoplysningerne til højre.

Kan du se dig selv i rollen og har du interesse i at blive en Fantastisk forbindelse søger du blot stillingen via linket øverst her på siden. Du behøver ikke skrive en ansøgning, men vi ser meget gerne et CV fra dig. Derudover har du mulighed for at sætte et par ord på dig selv gennem vores ansøgningsskema. 

Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig senest d. 29. september, men gerne før, da vi holder samtaler løbende.

Title: Performance Intelligence Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have a knack for uncovering game-changing insights from complex data? Can you transform numbers into compelling stories that drive customer behavior for global brands? If so, seize this opportunity to make a significant impact as a Performance Intelligence Consultant at VML MAP!

What will your day look like?

As Performance Intelligence Consultant, you'll be at the forefront of data-driven decision-making and play a vital role in understanding client priorities and objectives. With a foundational understanding of user experience and a strong grasp of data and analytical approaches, you'll be the bridge between data and strategy. Your daily activities will include conducting detailed data analysis to identify performance trends, designing and executing A/B tests and analyzing the results to provide optimization recommendations. You'll also be preparing and presenting performance reports, and your strong communication skills and storytelling abilities will ensure that actionable insights are delivered in an easily understood format, and in a way that motivates and provides a clear direction for various teams.

More Specifically, Your Tasks Include


Conduct detailed data analysis to identify performance trends and insights.
Prepare and present performance reports and translate the insights to internal teams as well as our clients, with a focus on content, audience, and channels.
Maintain and update performance dashboards and analytics tools.
Collaborate with various teams to ensure data-driven decision-making.
Design, execute and analyze A/B tests to identify the most effective strategies and tactics.
Approach all task with curiosity and open-mindedness, constantly striving to uncover further insights from the available data.


Who are you going to work with?

You'll join our growing Insights and Intelligence team, reporting to the Performance Intelligence Lead. You'll work closely with various teams, especially data and analytics specialists , and be the bridge between client and technical teams.

What do you bring to the table?

We're looking for curious minds with a strategic outlook and a passion for data. You're not just comfortable with numbers; you're adept at translating them into narratives that resonate with both technical and non-technical audiences, and you have a strong curiosity to discover the 'why' behind the data. Additionally, you are very collaboratively oriented, and you love working with cross-functional teams. Your expertise in detailed analysis and optimization will be instrumental in driving improvements and delivering actionable insights that enhance our daily tasks for clients.

In Addition, You Have


A strong understanding of marketing performance metrics such as open-rates, click through rates and journey data and experience analyzing campaign performance across digital channels.
Experience with data visualizations tools such as Power BI and Tableau. Knowledge of SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions and data manipulation.
Ability to translate complex data into understandable insights for non-technical audiences.
Skills in crafting compelling narratives from data insights.
Experience in presenting findings and recommendations to clients and/or Senior stakeholders.
Skills in managing expectations and building trust with clients and internal teams.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment with an open mind.
Understanding of A/B testing methodologies and tools.


A leader in personalized customer experiences

VML MAP is a world-leading Centre of Excellence that helps businesses humanize the relationship between the brand and the customer through hyper personalization at scale, marketing automation and CRM. With the brain of a consultancy, the heart of an agency and the power of technology and data, we work with some of the world's most admired brands to help them on their transformation journey to becoming truly customer-centric. Together, we are 1000 + technology specialists, data scientists, strategic thinkers, consultants, operations experts, and creative minds from 55+ nationalities.

A global network

We are part of the global VML network that encompasses more than 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 60+ markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

At VML, we are committed to fostering an all-inclusive work environment that is both rewarding and career-forward. Our Inclusion, Equity & Belonging initiatives, alongside the VML Foundation, reflect our dedication to giving back and making a positive impact in our communities and beyond. Our people are the heartbeat of our organization-creators, doers, innovators, makers, and thinkers-who drive not just marketing, but meaningful experiences that resonate in every action and interaction.

For more information, please visit our website , and follow us on our social channels via Instagram and LinkedIn .

When you click "Submit Application" your information is sent to VML MAP. To learn more about how we process your personal data when you apply for a role with us, how you can update your information, or have your information removed, please read our Privacy Policy . California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice .

Title: Data Engineer (Copenhagen based)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We seek a driven Data Engineer to join us as the 5th team member of Subsets and help us advance toward our vision of redefining Customer Relationship Management (CRM). As the fifth employee, you will be at the heart of our data operations and a core team member. This role offers an opportunity to shape the data infrastructure and directly influence product development at Subsets. You will collaborate with our software engineers and data scientists to build a scalable data infrastructure that powers our AI-driven platform.

At Subsets, we are developing the future of AI-driven Retention Automation for subscription media companies. To explain this in simple terms, consider the latest subscription you have held personally (news, streaming, etc.). The communication you have received as a subscriber was probably either non-existent, impersonal, not fitting your preferences, or not engaging. We are building Subsets to rethink this experience and increase subscribers' lifetime.

We are a small team backed by leading VCs, such as Y Combinator, and our customers include some of the largest subscription businesses in the world, such as Daily Mail (UK) and The Athletic (US). As a data engineer at Subsets, you will work directly with our customers' data and have the opportunity to shape and impact the product experience.

In this role, you will


Work directly with the founding team and our software engineers.
Design, develop, and manage our scalable data pipelines and ETL processes.
Monitor and optimize our data pipelines (we are moving a lot of data!).
Work in a small, high-performing team where you will influence the product.
Keep up with the latest developments in the space and see how they can be applied.


You may be a good fit if you have


A background in data engineering.
Hands-on experience in SQL, dbt and BigQuery, postgreSQL, or similar.
Have prior experience building ETL pipelines.
Experience working with Google Cloud Platform, AWS, or similar.
Experience working with Docker, Terraform, Python, or similar technologies.
The ability to work effectively in a startup environment where things change fast and are sometimes loosely defined.
This is neither an exhaustive nor necessary list of attributes. If none of these apply to you, but you believe you can contribute to Subsets, please reach out.


Benefits


Competitive salary
A stake in Subsets' success (equity)
A flexible work environment with frequent social activities
Great Lunch (and breakfast)


Applying


Send your resume and LinkedIn profile.
Typically, we will meet three times: 1) for an introductory coffee in our CPH office, 2) for an in-depth technical interview, and 3) to discuss our offer.
Note: Subsets does not accept fully remote applications. We value flexibility but prioritize working together from our Copenhagen office most of the time.


For more information or questions please contact us at hiring@subsets.com

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer til hurtigtvoksende scale-up virksomhed

 

Data er blevet et nøgleord hos Frameo, og derfor søger vi nu en Data Engineer med erfaring indenfor datahåndtering og -analyse, som kan hjælpe os til at styrke vores datastruktur og give værdifuld indsigt gennem vores store mængder data.




Hos Frameo udvikler vi software til Wi-Fi billedrammer, der med mere end 12 mio. app downloads er verdens førende. Du bliver en del af tech afdelingen, som består af en flok dedikerede og dygtige medarbejdere, hvor høj faglighed og godt kollegaskab er i højsædet.




Dine arbejdsopgaver:

Som Data Engineer hos os vil du spille en central rolle ift. at etablere og vedligeholde data-pipelines, sikre høj kvalitet af data og datastrukturer samt analysere og præsentere vores omfattende datamængder. Du vil arbejde med datasæt på flere terabytes, hvor der dagligt tilføjes hundredvis af gigabytes data. Du vil komme til at arbejde tæt sammen med både product management, tech, salg og ledelse for at skabe værdi af de store mængder data og understøtte beslutningsprocesser og forretningsudvikling i Frameo. 




Dine primære ansvarsområder vil omfatte:

Håndtering og strukturering af virksomhedens data i BigQuery
Udvikling og optimering af SQL-forespørgsler
Anvendelse af statistiske metoder til dataanalyse
Assistere med dataindsamling og identificering af datapunkter
Design og implementering af dashboards
Sikring af datakvalitet og -integritet
Udvikling og vedligehold af data pipelines (ETL jobs)




Om dig:

Du har 3-5 års erfaring i tilsvarende stilling, og vi ser gerne, at du også har en videregående uddannelse, hvor omdrejningspunktet har været dataanalyse, programmering eller tilsvarende. Derudover forventer vi, at du har: 

Solid erfaring med SQL
Erfaring med at arbejde med store datasæt (TB-skala)
Erfaring med statistiske analysemetoder
Erfaring med Cloud baserede data warehouse løsninger - i dag bruger vi BigQuery
Erfaring med visualiseringsværktøjer, eksempelvis Looker Studio
Stærke analytiske evner og sans for detaljer
Evne til at kommunikere komplekse data koncepter til ikke-tekniske interessenter







Hvad kan vi tilbyde dig?

Du vil blive en del af en spændende, ung scale-up virksomhed i vækst, hvor der er tæt samarbejde og kontakt på kryds og tværs af afdelinger i et uformelt kontormiljø. Der vil være høj grad af selvstændighed og frihed i stillingen med mulighed for at præge din egen dagligdag og udvikle dig både personligt og fagligt. 




Derudover tilbyder vi:  

Pensionsordning og sundhedsforsikring
Betalt telefoni, internet, mobiltelefon og arbejdscomputer
Mulighed for at arbejde hjemme




Du kommer med på vækstrejsen for en spændende ung virksomhed med store ambitioner. Derudover får du en masse gode kollegaer, som elsker at lave ting sammen - både på arbejdspladsen i form af f.eks. bordfodbold og udenfor arbejdstid i form af fredagsøl, brætspil, escape room, padel og meget andet. Trivsel og godt kollegaskab har høj prioritet hos os. 




Det praktiske:

Stillingen er på fuld tid (37 timer om ugen).




Vores kontor er centralt beliggende i Århus i Frichsparken.




Vi indkalder løbende til samtaler, så send din ansøgning allerede i dag.




Har du spørgsmål til stillingen så kontakt Head of Tech Jette Collie på +45 30316168 eller på jette.collie@frameo.com. 




Om Frameo

Frameo er en hurtigtvoksende scale-up virksomhed fra 2015, der består af et ungt team med masser af passion, god energi og stærke kompetencer. Vi udvikler software til Wi-Fi billedrammer, der med mere end 12 mio. app downloads og flere millioner brugere er verdens førende indenfor sit felt. 

Som en ambitiøs softwarevirksomhed er vi altid på udkig efter passionerede kollegaer inden for IT-området, der har lyst til at være en del af vores rejse. Du kan læse meget mere om Frameo på frameo.com/company

Title: Senior Statistician / Data Scientist
Place: Gladsaxe, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to use your statistical background to develop drugs and improve the lives for patients over the world? Do you want to help scientists in Novo Nordisk use their experimental resources and data in the best possible way? Are you passionate about extracting actionable insights from data and have a keen interest in digital transformation? If so, we offer an exciting position as Data Scientist/Statistician, so apply today!

 

The position
As a Senior Data Scientist/Statistician in CMC Development, you support the development of products, manufacturing processes and analytical methods together with four competent colleagues. You cooperate with colleagues from other areas of expertise across the organisation to solve their problems using advanced statistical methods. Good solutions balance business needs and quality requirements, and close collaboration with stakeholders is needed to ensure this. You will have the opportunity to leverage your exceptional communication skills and proactively engage with stakeholders within our organization to introduce and implement new ideas.

 

You can look forward to a broad variety of responsibilities, such as:

 



Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop, deliver, and present statistical solutions in a clear language and ensure that they are used as intended.
Engage with internal stakeholders to identify opportunities for innovation and drive the adoption of new ideas within the organization.
Utilize your expertise in data science to drive digital transformation and automate across CMC Development.




 

The statistical tools are often linear mixed models, design of experiments, general explorative statistics, multivariate statistics, and statistical process control.

It is important that you are curious by nature in terms of new technologies and have an interest in areas like e.g., Machine learning, digital transformation etc.

 

Qualifications

You have a strong background in mathematical statistics as Master's of Science or Ph.D. in statistics or engineering. Preferably you have at least 5 years of experience from a similar position in the pharmaceutical industry with a proven track record.

 

It will be considered an advantage if you have:



Experience with implementation of Machine learning models in controlled manufacturing environment.
Experience with SAS for Windows and SAS JMP
Experience with R and (or) Python.
Experience of working in consultancy role




 

As a person, you are curious and interested in other scientific disciplines. You attend to details and are systematic in your work, while also focusing on how to simplify complex matters to communicate clearly with other scientists, management, or regulatory authorities. You work independently and with high engagement.

 

About The Department

You are part of the function CMC Digitalisation, Data & Outsourcing that delivers specialised support to CMC Development & Scaling. We are five Data Scientists/statisticians in the department. We value creativity, innovation, and the ability to work with people of different backgrounds and focus on standardising and optimising work processes. You have ample opportunity to develop your professional and personal skills as well as influencing your job.

 

CMC Outsourcing and Data Science is a department of approx. 31 highly competent colleagues with the shared goal to support the Novo Nordisk drug development pipeline. The Data Science team in the department supports the Novo Nordisk drug development pipeline through statistical support and process optimisation.

 

Working at Novo Nordisk
At Novo Nordisk, we create value by putting patients first. Every ten seconds two people are diagnosed with diabetes, and close to 366 million people worldwide need us. Working here is not just a way to make a living, but a way to make a difference.

 

Contact
For further information, please contact Statistical Specialist Ken Sejling at +45 3079 9188 or Head of Data Science Abdul Rauf Khan at rakx@novonordisk.com.

 

Deadline
28 September 2024

 

Please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.

Do you want to use your statistical background to develop drugs and improve the lives for patients over the world? Do you want to help scientists in Novo Nordisk use their experimental resources and data in the best possible way? Are you passionate about extracting actionable insights from data and have a keen interest in digital transformation? If so, we offer an exciting position as Data Scientist/Statistician, so apply today!

 

The position
As a Senior Data Scientist/Statistician in CMC Development, you support the development of products, manufacturing processes and analytical methods together with four competent colleagues. You cooperate with colleagues from other areas of expertise across the organisation to solve their problems using advanced statistical methods. Good solutions balance business needs and quality requirements, and close collaboration with stakeholders is needed to ensure this. You will have the opportunity to leverage your exceptional communication skills and proactively engage with stakeholders within our organization to introduce and implement new ideas.

 

You can look forward to a broad variety of responsibilities, such as:

 


  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop, deliver, and present statistical solutions in a clear language and ensure that they are used as intended.
  • Engage with internal stakeholders to identify opportunities for innovation and drive the adoption of new ideas within the organization.
  • Utilize your expertise in data science to drive digital transformation and automate across CMC Development.



 

The statistical tools are often linear mixed models, design of experiments, general explorative statistics, multivariate statistics, and statistical process control.

It is important that you are curious by nature in terms of new technologies and have an interest in areas like e.g., Machine learning, digital transformation etc.

 

Qualifications

You have a strong background in mathematical statistics as Master's of Science or Ph.D. in statistics or engineering. Preferably you have at least 5 years of experience from a similar position in the pharmaceutical industry with a proven track record.

 

It will be considered an advantage if you have:


  • Experience with implementation of Machine learning models in controlled manufacturing environment.
  • Experience with SAS for Windows and SAS JMP
  • Experience with R and (or) Python.
  • Experience of working in consultancy role



 

As a person, you are curious and interested in other scientific disciplines. You attend to details and are systematic in your work, while also focusing on how to simplify complex matters to communicate clearly with other scientists, management, or regulatory authorities. You work independently and with high engagement.

 

About The Department

You are part of the function CMC Digitalisation, Data & Outsourcing that delivers specialised support to CMC Development & Scaling. We are five Data Scientists/statisticians in the department. We value creativity, innovation, and the ability to work with people of different backgrounds and focus on standardising and optimising work processes. You have ample opportunity to develop your professional and personal skills as well as influencing your job.

 

CMC Outsourcing and Data Science is a department of approx. 31 highly competent colleagues with the shared goal to support the Novo Nordisk drug development pipeline. The Data Science team in the department supports the Novo Nordisk drug development pipeline through statistical support and process optimisation.

 

Working at Novo Nordisk
At Novo Nordisk, we create value by putting patients first. Every ten seconds two people are diagnosed with diabetes, and close to 366 million people worldwide need us. Working here is not just a way to make a living, but a way to make a difference.

 

Contact
For further information, please contact Statistical Specialist Ken Sejling at +45 3079 9188 or Head of Data Science Abdul Rauf Khan at rakx@novonordisk.com.

28 September 2024
